commit_message:
Reorganize openstack drivers

We demote the OpenStack drivers in senlin into a special case. Next we
will need an abstraction layer for common operations such as building
credentials and authentication etc.

Change-Id: I884f6d62c388170a595261f463c0df0186bfc40c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 287, 'name': "Stefano Maffulli 'reed'", 'email': 'stefano@openstack.org', 'username': 'smaffulli'}, {'_account_id': 4556, 'name': 'Loic Dachary', 'username': 'loic'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 6923, 'name': 'Sean Roberts', 'email': 'seanroberts66@gmail.com', 'username': 'seanrob'}, {'_account_id': 7007, 'name': 'Pranav Salunke', 'email': 'dguitarbite@gmail.com', 'username': 'dguitarbite'}, {'_account_id': 9178, 'name': 'Sayali Lunkad', 'email': 'sayali.lunkad@suse.com', 'username': 'sayalilunkad'}, {'_account_id': 11109, 'name': 'Roger Luethi', 'email': 'rl@patchworkscience.org', 'username': 'rluethi'}, {'_account_id': 11889, 'name': 'Matjaz Pancur', 'email': 'matjaz.pancur@fri.uni-lj.si', 'username': 'matjazp'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-04-07 12:27:15.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'tools/generateslides', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Adds upstream training to OpenStack gate

Update the current gate 'slides' to build and publish upstream
training content. This patch does the following changes.

* Adds generateslides script to use sphinx/hieroglyph to build slides
* Updates tox.ini to use generateslides script
* Update .gitignore to ignore _build/ directory which is the default
  folder for generated output generated by sphix.

Hence forth, any changes to the upstream training rst slides will be
gated and published, also it is essential to note that these jobs are
new and may not be accurate or reliable to address all the errors in
the rst slides.

Change-Id: I8a220dd31501f9b3733a6282d7048fe283d2a0d1
"}]
commit_message:
Adds upstream training to OpenStack gate

Update the current gate 'slides' to build and publish upstream
training content. This patch does the following changes.

* Adds generateslides script to use sphinx/hieroglyph to build slides
* Updates tox.ini to use generateslides script
* Update .gitignore to ignore _build/ directory which is the default
  folder for generated output generated by sphix.

Hence forth, any changes to the upstream training rst slides will be
gated and published, also it is essential to note that these jobs are
new and may not be accurate or reliable to address all the errors in
the rst slides.

Change-Id: I8a220dd31501f9b3733a6282d7048fe283d2a0d1

subject: Forbid uploading packages, that extend classes not present in db
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-08 11:03:53.000000000', 'files': ['murano/db/catalog/api.py', 'murano/api/v1/catalog.py'], 'message': "Forbid uploading packages, that extend classes not present in db

Before one could upload a package that would contain a class, that
extends for example 'SqlDatabase' even if package with such class is not
present in app catalog. One would only find out the error at deploy
time.
Now api checks all the class definitions in the package being uploaded
and refuses to accept package, if it 'Extends' a class, that is not
found in db.

Change-Id: I2154a7d24eeec9614c667ac4198df4e0218413b2
Closes-Bug: #1399155
"}]
commit_message:
Forbid uploading packages, that extend classes not present in db

Before one could upload a package that would contain a class, that
extends for example 'SqlDatabase' even if package with such class is not
present in app catalog. One would only find out the error at deploy
time.
Now api checks all the class definitions in the package being uploaded
and refuses to accept package, if it 'Extends' a class, that is not
found in db.

Change-Id: I2154a7d24eeec9614c667ac4198df4e0218413b2
Closes-Bug: #1399155

commit_message:
Fix tagged-projects format to work properly

I7c6effe6e440f2147f8c68df090152e716c38fba added support to automatically
keep the 'Application to current projects' section pull from
projects.yaml but several of the tags used the wrong formatting causing
the tag pages to not list any projects as tagged.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-12 05:36:20.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/topics/settings.rst'], 'message': "Fixing typo in AVAILABLE_REGIONS section

Currently it says: A tuple of tuples which define multiple regions. But
actually it is a list of tuples, like:

AVAILABLE_REGIONS = [
    ('http://cluster1.example.com:5000/v2.0', 'cluster1'),
    ('http://cluster2.example.com:5000/v2.0', 'cluster2'),
]

Change-Id: Icbb4799689d650bac0bc17737b5747cff10a6154
Closes-Bug: #1442965
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing typo in AVAILABLE_REGIONS section

Currently it says: A tuple of tuples which define multiple regions. But
actually it is a list of tuples, like:

AVAILABLE_REGIONS = [
    ('http://cluster1.example.com:5000/v2.0', 'cluster1'),
    ('http://cluster2.example.com:5000/v2.0', 'cluster2'),
]

Change-Id: Icbb4799689d650bac0bc17737b5747cff10a6154
Closes-Bug: #1442965

commit_message:
Remove Oslo from the flask API application

Oslo is tied very closely with the OpenStack components, and most
application writers are not familiar with these libraries. In order to
make this application easier to understand, the more well documented
flask configuration is used.

http://flask.pocoo.org/docs/0.10/config/

Change-Id: I88b5b6bb594cbbbeb0b31e1715bf6c86124837dd

subject: Stop running gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-keystoneclient-juno
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-11 17:38:29.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Stop running gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-keystoneclient-juno

These 2 jobs were running on python-keystoneclient for all branches:

- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-keystoneclient
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-keystoneclient-juno

Since python-keystoneclient has a stable/juno branch now, there's no
need for gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-keystoneclient-juno.

Change-Id: I8bee549cf9119672680d36af3dff45f16537ba91
"}]
commit_message:
Stop running gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-keystoneclient-juno

These 2 jobs were running on python-keystoneclient for all branches:

- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-keystoneclient
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-keystoneclient-juno

Since python-keystoneclient has a stable/juno branch now, there's no
need for gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-keystoneclient-juno.

Change-Id: I8bee549cf9119672680d36af3dff45f16537ba91

subject: make stop_neutron actually stop neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-11 10:37:50.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron'], 'message': "make stop_neutron actually stop neutron

stop_neutron doesn't actually stop neutron. The only reason grenade
neutron job was working was due to some blanket kills that never got
removed. As you can see it doesn't even actually attempt to stop most
of the services in question. Apparently it's doing some edge case
cleaning because neutron services don't actually shut down their child
processes correctly.

This actually makes stop_neutron do a thing.

Change-Id: I9138a8370be06e6c9d2dacbec1b0ffd4928e603d
"}]
commit_message:
make stop_neutron actually stop neutron

stop_neutron doesn't actually stop neutron. The only reason grenade
neutron job was working was due to some blanket kills that never got
removed. As you can see it doesn't even actually attempt to stop most
of the services in question. Apparently it's doing some edge case
cleaning because neutron services don't actually shut down their child
processes correctly.

This actually makes stop_neutron do a thing.

Change-Id: I9138a8370be06e6c9d2dacbec1b0ffd4928e603d

subject: Add check-tempest-dsvm-f21 to experimental queue for openstack/nova
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-08 19:55:35.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Add check-tempest-dsvm-f21 to experimental queue for openstack/nova

Live snapshot with the nova libvirt driver is disabled by default
because we know that it race fails in the gate with libvirt 1.2.2 on
Ubuntu Trusty 14.04.

The Fedora 21 job runs with libvirt-1.2.9.2 and qemu-kvm-2.1.3 so if we
need to test experimental features in the libvirt driver that are
enabled conditionally based on versions of libvirt/qemu we're testing
against, we should be able to use the Fedora 21 job in the experimental
queue for that now.

Related-Bug: #1334398

Change-Id: Idd7cca3b77147be6583c78c6a811a5f411ad5bf4
"}]
commit_message:
Add check-tempest-dsvm-f21 to experimental queue for openstack/nova

Live snapshot with the nova libvirt driver is disabled by default
because we know that it race fails in the gate with libvirt 1.2.2 on
Ubuntu Trusty 14.04.

The Fedora 21 job runs with libvirt-1.2.9.2 and qemu-kvm-2.1.3 so if we
need to test experimental features in the libvirt driver that are
enabled conditionally based on versions of libvirt/qemu we're testing
against, we should be able to use the Fedora 21 job in the experimental
queue for that now.

Related-Bug: #1334398

Change-Id: Idd7cca3b77147be6583c78c6a811a5f411ad5bf4

subject: virt: Make sure block device info is persisted
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 1063, 'name': 'Ed Leafe', 'email': 'ed@leafe.com', 'username': 'ed-leafe'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7730, 'name': 'Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui', 'email': 'sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com', 'username': 'sahid'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-02 11:31:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/test_block_device.py', 'nova/virt/block_device.py'], 'message': "virt: Make sure block device info is persisted

There are several methods that we wrap with a @update_db decorator,
which is to say that we want the data that changed on the object to be
persisted once the method has done it's work.

However in case of exceptions, we would do some local cleanup and
propagate the exception to through the stack, which would cause the db
save to not happen (due to the way the 'update_db' decorator was
written).

This is not ideal since some of those methods such as 'attach()' do
several interaction (with the Cinder API and libvirt for example), and
making sure that results of successfull ones are persisted in case of
a non immediate failure is important for later cleanup, and keeping
the system in a consistent state.

This patch makes sure that we persist data to the DB at all times.

Change-Id: Icf8dbe4e3b7fd65b3c7a5eb479d6be15ee504253
Closes-bug: #1439282
"}]
commit_message:
virt: Make sure block device info is persisted

There are several methods that we wrap with a @update_db decorator,
which is to say that we want the data that changed on the object to be
persisted once the method has done it's work.

However in case of exceptions, we would do some local cleanup and
propagate the exception to through the stack, which would cause the db
save to not happen (due to the way the 'update_db' decorator was
written).

This is not ideal since some of those methods such as 'attach()' do
several interaction (with the Cinder API and libvirt for example), and
making sure that results of successfull ones are persisted in case of
a non immediate failure is important for later cleanup, and keeping
the system in a consistent state.

This patch makes sure that we persist data to the DB at all times.

Change-Id: Icf8dbe4e3b7fd65b3c7a5eb479d6be15ee504253
Closes-bug: #1439282

commit_message:
Nova Kilofication Work

* API Versions 1.1 and 3 have been deprecated from nova, plays
  have been modified to completely remove v1.1 and make v3
  optional via nova_v3_deprecated_but_enabled boolean.
* Addition of v2.1 api configuration.
* Elimination of the unused nova_api_ec2 container.
* nova_spice_console has been renamed to nova_console and
  nova_spice_console_container has been renamed to
  nova_console_container to facilitate different consoles in
  the future.
* Spice has been made the default console.
* A standalone task and init scripts for nova_spice.

- Fixed some typos
- Modified HAProxy role to remove nova_api_ec2 and rename
  nova_spice_console to nova_console
- Updated user_secrets.yml
- Unbroke things that I broke

Partially Implements Blueprint: master-kilofication

Change-Id: Ia87dfb1e8c0316103a30e2121f11996a9ca87c25

commit_message:
Updated galera cache size when boostrapping AIO

This change modifies the cache sizes for galera when bootstrapping
an AIO. This change lowers the cache sizes to allow the for normal
operations on hosts that may be resource constrained.

Change-Id: Ie7b9c12a3231b92e6414e97f535ec128d13bf2d2
Closes-Bug: #1442028

subject: volume discard option
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-18 08:51:32.000000000', 'files': ['specs/juno/volume-discard-option.rst'], 'message': "volume discard option

Currently, libvirt/qemu has support discard option when attaching a volume
to an instance. With this feature, the unmap/trim command can be send from
guest to the final storage device. It's valualbe for the volume backed on
SSD storages or the storage diskarray which suppport this command.

So nova needs to get assist from the cinder to decide whether to enable the
discard option when attaching the cinder volume.

This spec aims to add the assist to support enabling discard for cinder
volumes.

blueprint volume-discard-option

Change-Id: I2bd9bad016c1f7085a1dfe64826244e086dcd39b
"}]
commit_message:
volume discard option

Currently, libvirt/qemu has support discard option when attaching a volume
to an instance. With this feature, the unmap/trim command can be send from
guest to the final storage device. It's valualbe for the volume backed on
SSD storages or the storage diskarray which suppport this command.

So nova needs to get assist from the cinder to decide whether to enable the
discard option when attaching the cinder volume.

This spec aims to add the assist to support enabling discard for cinder
volumes.

blueprint volume-discard-option

Change-Id: I2bd9bad016c1f7085a1dfe64826244e086dcd39b

subject: Set connection timeout in container sync
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 866, 'name': 'Chmouel Boudjnah', 'email': 'chmouel@chmouel.com', 'username': 'chmouel'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 8542, 'name': 'Prashanth Pai', 'email': 'ppai@redhat.com', 'username': 'pai'}, {'_account_id': 9816, 'name': 'Takashi Kajinami', 'email': 'kajinamit@oss.nttdata.com', 'username': 'kajinamit'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14271, 'name': 'Kallebe Monteiro', 'email': 'kallebe.monteiro@lsbd.ufc.br', 'username': 'kallebe'}, {'_account_id': 15090, 'name': 'Elvis Teixeira', 'email': 'elvis.teixeira@lsbd.ufc.br', 'username': 'ElvisTeixeira'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-04-10 10:06:40.000000000', 'files': ['swift/container/sync.py', 'test/unit/common/test_internal_client.py', 'etc/container-server.conf-sample', 'test/unit/container/test_sync.py'], 'message': 'Set connection timeout in container sync

Container sync might get stuck without a connection timeout if the remote proxy
is not responding.

This patch sets a default timeout of 5.0 seconds for the connection attempt. The
value is much higher than other connection timeouts inside Swift (0.5); however
there might be a much higher latency to the remote peer, thus playing it safe.
There is also a retry if the attempt timed out.

Note that this setting only applies to the connection request itself. Setting
this timeout does not apply when the remote proxy goes away during a request.

Also added a short test to ensure urlopen is called with the timeout value.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hp.com>

Change-Id: Ic08a55157fa91fe1316653781adf4d66eead61bc
Partial-Bug: 1419916
'}]
commit_message:
Set connection timeout in container sync

Container sync might get stuck without a connection timeout if the remote proxy
is not responding.

This patch sets a default timeout of 5.0 seconds for the connection attempt. The
value is much higher than other connection timeouts inside Swift (0.5); however
there might be a much higher latency to the remote peer, thus playing it safe.
There is also a retry if the attempt timed out.

Note that this setting only applies to the connection request itself. Setting
this timeout does not apply when the remote proxy goes away during a request.

Also added a short test to ensure urlopen is called with the timeout value.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hp.com>

Change-Id: Ic08a55157fa91fe1316653781adf4d66eead61bc
Partial-Bug: 1419916

commit_message:
Validate scheme used in urlopen

An invalid url scheme could be used in urlopen in the python k8s
swagger client to violate security.  Validate that the URL is either
http or https and turn off noise from bandit.

Change-Id: I15fe8f9953e526beb25d84895ed3925a758ccda4
Implements: blueprint gate-bandit

commit_message:
Updated Protocol named constants

The L3 protocol name constants should be removed from
neutron/plugins/common/constants.py because for instance, there
exists a constant already in neutron/common/constants.py for
tcp - PROTO_NAME_TCP.

Moved out FWaaS specific constants from
neutron.plugins.common.constants to here.

Reference:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/166879/

Change-Id: Ic9dc026f4165c3ea00d472bfb7bd8edaf89ce7c0

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-12 20:17:15.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/common/pythonk8sclient/client/swagger.py'], 'message': 'Remove unsafe usage of eval

eval will execute a function before it has been determined to be
a python data type.  Instead, use ast.literal_eval which validates
the object is a data type before executing it.

See:
    http://nedbatchelder.com/blog/201206/eval_really_is_dangerous.html

Change-Id: Ia3d74747e66d72e97a3fb9029bd51331c902f874
Partially-Implements: blueprint gate-bandit
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unsafe usage of eval

eval will execute a function before it has been determined to be
a python data type.  Instead, use ast.literal_eval which validates
the object is a data type before executing it.

See:
    http://nedbatchelder.com/blog/201206/eval_really_is_dangerous.html

Change-Id: Ia3d74747e66d72e97a3fb9029bd51331c902f874
Partially-Implements: blueprint gate-bandit

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 668, 'name': 'Adrian Otto', 'email': 'aotto@aotto.com', 'username': 'aotto'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6698, 'name': 'Robert Pothier', 'email': 'robpothier35@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpothier'}, {'_account_id': 7049, 'name': 'Kai Qiang Wu(Kennan)', 'email': 'wkq5325@gmail.com', 'username': 'Kennan'}, {'_account_id': 7494, 'name': 'Guangya Liu', 'email': 'gyliu513@gmail.com', 'username': 'JayLau'}, {'_account_id': 10206, 'name': 'Madhuri Kumari', 'email': 'madhuri.kumari@intel.com', 'username': 'Madhuri'}, {'_account_id': 11861, 'name': 'Travis McPeak', 'email': 'tmcpeak@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'travis-mcpeak'}, {'_account_id': 12385, 'name': 'Motohiro/Yuanying Otsuka', 'email': 'yuanying@fraction.jp', 'username': 'yuanying'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-12 20:17:16.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/common/yamlutils.py', 'magnum/common/k8s_manifest.py'], 'message': "Use yaml.safe_loader instead of yaml.loader

yaml.loader is unsafe from a security perspective.  From the
documentation:

Warning: It is not safe to call yaml.load with any data received
from an untrusted source! yaml.load is as powerful as pickle.load
and so may call any Python function.

I am pretty sure we don't want k8s users calling any python function ;-)

Change-Id: I7d2bb64d7920f530657426d2a1dc5780ebb95a47
Paritally-Implements: blueprint gate-bandit
"}]
commit_message:
Use yaml.safe_loader instead of yaml.loader

yaml.loader is unsafe from a security perspective.  From the
documentation:

Warning: It is not safe to call yaml.load with any data received
from an untrusted source! yaml.load is as powerful as pickle.load
and so may call any Python function.

I am pretty sure we don't want k8s users calling any python function ;-)

Change-Id: I7d2bb64d7920f530657426d2a1dc5780ebb95a47
Paritally-Implements: blueprint gate-bandit

commit_message:
Eliminate warnings in powervm driver

To get nova_powervm.virt.powervm.driver warning-free:

o Refreshed method signatures from ComputeDriver.
o Added explicit import of taskflow.task.
o Made a couple of private methods static.

No functional changes.

Change-Id: I96a7c2c34b2ea6f37beeded601fc11824c1a3ce0

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-26 11:51:05.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore'], 'message': "Git ignore covhtml directory

The covhtml directory is created when tests are run with coverage report
flag and it contains HTML files with code coverage:

./run_tests.sh -c

This patch adds the covhtml directory to gitignore, so it won't be
tracked by the Git (similar ignore has been already introducted in
Cinder, Nova and Neutron).

Change-Id: I4f06640d893e241bfdec23520271abb20b1dc91d
"}]
commit_message:
Git ignore covhtml directory

The covhtml directory is created when tests are run with coverage report
flag and it contains HTML files with code coverage:

./run_tests.sh -c

This patch adds the covhtml directory to gitignore, so it won't be
tracked by the Git (similar ignore has been already introducted in
Cinder, Nova and Neutron).

Change-Id: I4f06640d893e241bfdec23520271abb20b1dc91d

commit_message:
Fix instructions in README.rst file

The current test commands as shown in the README.rst file does not
work. The 'curl' command requires additional headers that are not
mentioned in the README.rst file.  This patch provides a working
command sequence to fix it.

Closes-Bug: 1349568

commit_message:
Update links to setuptools doc.

commit_message:
added network id field in update network model

In update network model, only name field is shown.
Since duplicate name is allowed, it is difficult to differentiate the two with same name.

This patch adding the readonly text input to show the network id.

Change-Id: I15096b65d6b410e36d7eb5d99c767b9dc8e801a1
Closes-Bug: #1442031

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-04-08 17:12:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/commands.py', 'neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/idlutils.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py'], 'message': 'Handle non-index lookups in native OVSDB backend

ovs-vsctl get/set/clear/list can use a record_id that is not an
index on the table being queried. For example, the Controller table
can be queried by a bridge name.

This patch implements the lookup table that ovs-vsctl uses to do
these lookups.

Change-Id: I1983c48c5839df016046ba2596c7c4affa1ebe00
Closes-Bug: 1435567
'}]
commit_message:
Handle non-index lookups in native OVSDB backend

ovs-vsctl get/set/clear/list can use a record_id that is not an
index on the table being queried. For example, the Controller table
can be queried by a bridge name.

This patch implements the lookup table that ovs-vsctl uses to do
these lookups.

Change-Id: I1983c48c5839df016046ba2596c7c4affa1ebe00
Closes-Bug: 1435567

commit_message:
Makes kombu_ssl_* parameters optional when rabbit_use_ssl => true

The kombu_ssl_* parameters should not be required when rabbit_use_ssl => true
Rather, rabbit_use_ssl must be set to true if the kombu_ssl_* parameters are
used.

Change-Id: I5ddd3d0910094c31352243d3b674dff79e891dda
Closes-Bug: 1356083

subject: Add new smoke tests for RSA type containers and secrets
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7136, 'name': 'Chad Lung', 'email': 'chad.lung@gmail.com', 'username': 'chadlung'}, {'_account_id': 7973, 'name': 'Douglas Mendiz√°bal', 'email': 'dmendiza@redhat.com', 'username': 'dougmendizabal'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11561, 'name': 'Dave McCowan', 'email': 'dmccowan@cisco.com', 'username': 'dave-mccowan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-04-12 04:09:46.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/api/v1/behaviors/secret_behaviors.py', 'functionaltests/common/keys.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/smoke/test_rsa.py'], 'message': 'Add new smoke tests for RSA type containers and secrets

This adds new functional tests that mimic the curl test
examples in doc/source/api/reference/secret_types.rst.

The new tests are:
  Create private secret with POST.
  Create private secret with POST and PUT.
  Create public secret with POST.
  Create public secret with POST and PUT.
  Create passphrase secret with POST.
  Create RSA container with POST.
  Order RSA container
  Order certifciates

The secrets used in this test are generated using OpenSSL.
Per the API reference, the stored and retrieved
secret values should match.

The secret formats are:
  private: PKCS#8 PEM
  public: PEM
  passphrase: text
  certificate: PEM

Secrets sent in JSON via POST are base64 encoded
Secrets sent in the body via POST and PUT are sent natively

The public and private tests fail pending a fix for 1441866.

Change-Id: I82d9864e0ee6e20d1f07b0f171c776ac4ea24171
'}]
commit_message:
Add new smoke tests for RSA type containers and secrets

This adds new functional tests that mimic the curl test
examples in doc/source/api/reference/secret_types.rst.

The new tests are:
  Create private secret with POST.
  Create private secret with POST and PUT.
  Create public secret with POST.
  Create public secret with POST and PUT.
  Create passphrase secret with POST.
  Create RSA container with POST.
  Order RSA container
  Order certifciates

The secrets used in this test are generated using OpenSSL.
Per the API reference, the stored and retrieved
secret values should match.

The secret formats are:
  private: PKCS#8 PEM
  public: PEM
  passphrase: text
  certificate: PEM

Secrets sent in JSON via POST are base64 encoded
Secrets sent in the body via POST and PUT are sent natively

The public and private tests fail pending a fix for 1441866.

Change-Id: I82d9864e0ee6e20d1f07b0f171c776ac4ea24171

subject: Add a way to set the libvirt/volume_drivers option
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 9410, 'name': 'Yanis Guenane', 'email': 'yguenane@redhat.com', 'username': 'yguenane'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 13407, 'name': 'Maik Zumstrull', 'email': 'm.zumstrull@syseleven.de', 'username': 'mzumstrull'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-17 08:47:51.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/nova_compute_libvirt_spec.rb', 'manifests/compute/libvirt.pp'], 'message': 'Add a way to set the libvirt/volume_drivers option

The default of "load all drivers that come with stock OpenStack Nova"
should work for anybody using stock OpenStack, but when your local
installation has been extended with custom drivers, you need a way to
load them.

Change-Id: I35ba4be143f2a639ac91b704ae6291c9caf89fa7
'}]
commit_message:
Add a way to set the libvirt/volume_drivers option

The default of "load all drivers that come with stock OpenStack Nova"
should work for anybody using stock OpenStack, but when your local
installation has been extended with custom drivers, you need a way to
load them.

Change-Id: I35ba4be143f2a639ac91b704ae6291c9caf89fa7

commit_message:
Expose listener notification type + docs

Since this type is returned via the `listeners_iter`
method we should ensure that its docs are published
and that it's methods and attributes/properties are
exposed so that people can know what it is and what
can be used.

Change-Id: I15e72df2822455be24921a4413aed3fa4f715443

subject: Avoid flushing br-ex during stacking
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 6524, 'name': 'Henry Gessau', 'email': 'HenryG@gessau.net', 'username': 'gessau'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-10 06:00:26.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/ovs_base'], 'message': 'Avoid flushing br-ex during stacking

This operation seems vestigial, as it was added to the code when stack.sh
did not have a robust cleanup procedure. These days, unstack.sh does destroy
all bridges, therefore during subsequent stack.sh runs (or even initially, from
a clean environment), the flush operation has become superfluous.

Its removal has also been deemeded necessary to enable certain multi-node
cloud deployments, like the one available in OpenStack infra [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/158525/

Change-Id: I6b4e5b82958e6d29dd450f1c4c9513f6a9e5053a
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid flushing br-ex during stacking

This operation seems vestigial, as it was added to the code when stack.sh
did not have a robust cleanup procedure. These days, unstack.sh does destroy
all bridges, therefore during subsequent stack.sh runs (or even initially, from
a clean environment), the flush operation has become superfluous.

Its removal has also been deemeded necessary to enable certain multi-node
cloud deployments, like the one available in OpenStack infra [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/158525/

Change-Id: I6b4e5b82958e6d29dd450f1c4c9513f6a9e5053a

available in oslo.vmware. One of the reference was missed during
the refactor.

subject: Image corruption should not fail with not enough hosts available
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6062, 'name': 'jichenjc', 'email': 'jichenjc@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jichenjc'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15750, 'name': 'Julian Edwards', 'email': 'bigjools@gmail.com', 'username': 'bigjools'}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-02 01:58:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Image corruption should not fail with not enough hosts available

We should catch ProcessExecution errors and fail them instead of
trying to retry scheduling these requests. They would just fail
again. Also, the proper error message is not sent back to the
user and they won't know the real problem until someone looks
in the logs. We've seen this in the gate as well (bug 1303802).

Closes-Bug: #1436166
Change-Id: I644d69443b4a5c72c9cae233413e711f1f88d0e3
"}]
commit_message:
Image corruption should not fail with not enough hosts available

We should catch ProcessExecution errors and fail them instead of
trying to retry scheduling these requests. They would just fail
again. Also, the proper error message is not sent back to the
user and they won't know the real problem until someone looks
in the logs. We've seen this in the gate as well (bug 1303802).

Closes-Bug: #1436166
Change-Id: I644d69443b4a5c72c9cae233413e711f1f88d0e3

Changes:
  - Added flags for manually specifying rally installation and config path
  - Added mandatory flag to allow force overwrite of existing rally installation.
  - Checks for existing installation and if specified venv is in use.

Change-Id: I3e6240b167de057d89ddd09c9dc8558cd3cde7f1
Closes-Bug: #1413105
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for installing rally to multiple virtual environments

Changes:
  - Added flags for manually specifying rally installation and config path
  - Added mandatory flag to allow force overwrite of existing rally installation.
  - Checks for existing installation and if specified venv is in use.

Change-Id: I3e6240b167de057d89ddd09c9dc8558cd3cde7f1
Closes-Bug: #1413105

commit_message:
set default auth_strategy to keystone

Like in change Ife63dc7ab680fcf0588d95c98fc9f29901485c64 for Nova
the default for auth_strategy should be keystone instead of noauth.

DocImpact Changed default config option 'auth_strategy' to 'keystone'.

Change-Id: Ia72c5bf9be641b438a4d428ba43e501d1aa333d6
Closes-Bug: #1327503

commit_message:
instance termination with update_dns_entries set fails

In If9554a2e98397c5e63e929e1606d99dd2328262c, changed the "fixed_ips"
array to contain a list of string ip address, rather than fixed_ip
objects, but neglected to update the code under the
CONF.update_dns_entries branch below to match. We need to
build a list of unique network ids for update_dns_entries.

Closes-Bug: #1427295
Change-Id: I60e9148d1120d308d33d48a67912a595a3353d67

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-01 18:23:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'Filter fixed IPs from requested_networks in deallocate_for_instance

With nova-network, the fixed IP address is optional on the server create
request.

Tempest commit 9ce97dfa353e3659aa0ec0a7f62ed3a7e54c4bdf merged on 3/26
and we started seeing "FixedIpNotFoundForAddress: Fixed ip not found for
address None." in successful gate runs because with the Tempest change
the network uuid is passed in (if available) on the boot request but
there is no address provided, e.g.:

Body: {"server": {"imageRef": "328dba0f-f13b-47eb-bfce-6e3f6ab07eaa",
"return_reservation_id": true, "flavorRef": "42", "name":
"multiple-create-test-971632462", "min_count": 1, "networks": [{"uuid":
"cf357903-a60c-4b1c-8524-a0aaa4bb2fe7"}], "max_count": 2}}

When deleting an instance before it's completely built, we try to
deallocate the network and that failed since deallocate_for_instance
wasn't filtering out None addresses from requested_networks.

This fixes the problem by simply filtering the list of fixed IPs from
requested_networks before trying to deallocate the fixed IPs.

Closes-Bug: #1439302

Change-Id: I459a98151406a0b125a65b00fa0186eb5df97b1c
'}]
commit_message:
Filter fixed IPs from requested_networks in deallocate_for_instance

With nova-network, the fixed IP address is optional on the server create
request.

Tempest commit 9ce97dfa353e3659aa0ec0a7f62ed3a7e54c4bdf merged on 3/26
and we started seeing "FixedIpNotFoundForAddress: Fixed ip not found for
address None." in successful gate runs because with the Tempest change
the network uuid is passed in (if available) on the boot request but
there is no address provided, e.g.:

Body: {"server": {"imageRef": "328dba0f-f13b-47eb-bfce-6e3f6ab07eaa",
"return_reservation_id": true, "flavorRef": "42", "name":
"multiple-create-test-971632462", "min_count": 1, "networks": [{"uuid":
"cf357903-a60c-4b1c-8524-a0aaa4bb2fe7"}], "max_count": 2}}

When deleting an instance before it's completely built, we try to
deallocate the network and that failed since deallocate_for_instance
wasn't filtering out None addresses from requested_networks.

This fixes the problem by simply filtering the list of fixed IPs from
requested_networks before trying to deallocate the fixed IPs.

Closes-Bug: #1439302

Change-Id: I459a98151406a0b125a65b00fa0186eb5df97b1c

commit_message:
Add explicit reactive enforcment

This patch causes policy statements that use
the modal 'execute' in the heads of rules to
invoke actions implemented by datasource drivers.

Change-Id: I811a6525762284728e8276203072ae75504dcdb9

When some exception occur in funciton _live_migration,
the _rollback_live_migration() will be called, and the variable
"migrate_date" must be imported, which as the specific params,
otherwise the instance path will be not deleted and causes next

commit_message:
Fix live migration can not rollback resource correctly

When some exception occur in funciton _live_migration,
the _rollback_live_migration() will be called, and the variable
"migrate_date" must be imported, which as the specific params,
otherwise the instance path will be not deleted and causes next
live-migration to fail.

Change-Id: I1469ea7fafc9bc511f960dbec8647f734ffd6826
Closes-Bug: #1415001

commit_message:
Use the ksc Adapter instead of custom HTTPClient

Keystoneclient provides the adapter to make it easier for projects to
work with sessions. It allows more flexibility in querying the service
catalog, and additional http options in a consistent way across
projects.

Change-Id: Ief96aec1057847ac0fde14f4a98b3d7b146415a4

commit_message:
Remove old relation in Cells for ComputeNode and Service

add_cell_to_service was still checking if compute_node was returned but now that
the DB model is no longer having a FK nor a relationship, it's always returning
nothing so we can fix the fake mocks and we can remove the conditional.

Change-Id: Ib8e85b3daf2c13e8b55ca33e31605abee57a03a4
Related-Bug: #1423237

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-09 00:24:56.000000000', 'files': ['bandit.yaml', 'test-requirements-bandit.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add Bandit security static analysis checking via tox

The plan is to add Bandit to the commit gate.  Bandit is
produced by the OpenStack security team to do static code
analysis for security implementation failures.  It tests
the code base for ~30 common security problems in Python
with more to come.  The bandit.yaml configuration file
is set to the value recommended by the Bandit team.

run with:
    tox -e bandit

Change-Id: I46cde803119d0162b6256346e423079cadac17cb
Partially-Implements: blueprint gate-bandit
'}]
commit_message:
Add Bandit security static analysis checking via tox

The plan is to add Bandit to the commit gate.  Bandit is
produced by the OpenStack security team to do static code
analysis for security implementation failures.  It tests
the code base for ~30 common security problems in Python
with more to come.  The bandit.yaml configuration file
is set to the value recommended by the Bandit team.

run with:
    tox -e bandit

Change-Id: I46cde803119d0162b6256346e423079cadac17cb
Partially-Implements: blueprint gate-bandit

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-10 15:14:54.000000000', 'files': ['networking_l2gw/services/l2gateway/plugin.py', 'networking_l2gw/tests/unit/services/l2gateway/test_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Fix for the launchpad bug 1440649

The patch set fixes the problem described
in the launchpad bug 1440649 where deletion
of an existing l2gw connection fails.
The code logic in the service plugin (inside
the method delete_port_mac) handled
the case where the incoming argument was a dict.
It, however, did not handle the case where
the incoming argument was a list.

Closes-Bug: 1440649
Change-Id: Id315416b12b6af581aa768c1378fae6496c342f5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for the launchpad bug 1440649

The patch set fixes the problem described
in the launchpad bug 1440649 where deletion
of an existing l2gw connection fails.
The code logic in the service plugin (inside
the method delete_port_mac) handled
the case where the incoming argument was a dict.
It, however, did not handle the case where
the incoming argument was a list.

Closes-Bug: 1440649
Change-Id: Id315416b12b6af581aa768c1378fae6496c342f5

commit_message:
ucast_macs and physical_locators deletion problem

The patch set fixes the problem described in
the launchpad bug 1440691 where the plugin
was not able to delete entries from
ucast_macs_remotes and physical_locators
tables when l2-gateway-connection-delete deletes
the entries from the corresponding OVSDB
server tables, and the OVSDB server sends
delete notifications to the plugin via
the L2gw agent.

Closes-Bug: 1440691
Change-Id: Ib5e18f7a278f2e8d13d5fc271826599c49b141e7

commit_message:
l2-gateway-connection-create reports OVSDBError

The patch set fixes
1. a problem described in the
bug 1440301 where the L2gateway agent throws
a syntax error as the logical switch is passed
as a list inside a list.
2. a problem where the database model
cannot store the value of the string
"unspecified-fault" in 16 character column width
for the port fault status and switch fault status.
3. a problem where the L2gateway agent and the plugin
do not handle empty port and switch fault status
which makes validation of the logical gateway fail
when an l2-gateway-connection is created.

Closes-Bug:1440301
Change-Id: Id4530b26407f2a6d57de7254476d77a36bb70a27

commit_message:
Ensure listener args are always a tuple/immutable

Make sure the arguments are not mutable and can not
be modified by anyone so that the listener maintains
a read-only state after it has been created (immutability
is typically always good & preferred).

Change-Id: I819ea43e6e7e77179e15df3ecbb7c39e96c0592f

commit_message:
websocketproxy: Make protocol validation use connection_info

With this change, we avoid the need to have config '*_baseurl' config
options correctly set up on nodes running console-proxy services, as the
access_url is now available after token validation.

UpgradeImpact: Websocket proxies need to be upgraded in a lockstep
with the API nodes up to this commit (or when upgrading to Kilo),
as older API nodes will not be sending the access_url when authorizing
console access, and newer proxy services (this commit and onward) would
fail to authorize such requests.

Change-Id: I721bca407bf9d3fb33a3461c04d392284448d4a6
Closes-bug: #1442048

message pops up, but everything works.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-07 15:57:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/cells_api.py', 'nova/consoleauth/rpcapi.py', 'nova/consoleauth/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/consoleauth/test_rpcapi.py'], 'message': "consoleauth: Store access_url on token authorization

Related-bug: 1409142

As part of the fix for the related bug - we've added protocol checking
to mitigate MITM attacks, however we base protocol checking on a config
option that is normally only intended for compute hosts.

This is quite user hostile, as it is now important that all nodes
running compute and proxy services have this option in sync.

We can do better than that - we can persist the URL the client is
expected to use, and once we get it back on token validation, we can
make sure that the request is using the intended protocol, mitigating
the MITM injected script attacks.

This patch makes sure that the access_url is persisted with the token -
the follow-up patch makes consoles use that info.

Change-Id: I02a377f54de46536ca35413b615d3298967afc33
"}]
commit_message:
consoleauth: Store access_url on token authorization

Related-bug: 1409142

As part of the fix for the related bug - we've added protocol checking
to mitigate MITM attacks, however we base protocol checking on a config
option that is normally only intended for compute hosts.

This is quite user hostile, as it is now important that all nodes
running compute and proxy services have this option in sync.

We can do better than that - we can persist the URL the client is
expected to use, and once we get it back on token validation, we can
make sure that the request is using the intended protocol, mitigating
the MITM injected script attacks.

This patch makes sure that the access_url is persisted with the token -
the follow-up patch makes consoles use that info.

Change-Id: I02a377f54de46536ca35413b615d3298967afc33

commit_message:
consoleauth: remove an instance of mutation while iterating

Mutating a list while iterating over it is a big python no-no. Let's not
do it in consoleauth service anymore.

Change-Id: I50d201f3f39576d7a32b722ead0667fd9abaeb75

commit_message:
requests skip 2.2.1

keystoneclient unit tests are failing with requests 2.2.1. The next
release is 2.3.0, and that works, so use that.

The failure is like:

  Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "keystoneclient/tests/v3/test_auth_saml2.py", line 621, in test_end_to_end_workflow

commit_message:
Add json-schema for v2.1 fixed-ips

This patch adds json-schema for v2.1 fixed-ips. The json-schame limits
the input for actions reserve/unreserve. Also fixed the API sample
file at same time and add parameter_type none.

Co-Authored-By: Ken'ichi Ohmichi <ken1ohmichi@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id2d0416c3ccc2a50d3cb66bed8747082f98fb194
Closes-Bug: #1438480

commit_message:
Disable redundant functionality with env creation

In case there are no environments,
there are two options for creating a new one.
It's confusing and main table button is hidden until first environment creation.

Change-Id: I7ca2d39eb69ecaa2d0ec1bfbe352fce0ff4041f3
Closes-Bug: #1442667

commit_message:
Forbid the user to specify custom ports during creating docker-apps

At the moment there is no mechanism to change container port for
application. Thus, we shouldn't allow the user to specify custom
ports apart from cases when application requires explicit network
configuration and ports must be specified as environment variables

Change-Id: I66a2db8ab7709e7d3ecc88547d97111f4179f267
Closes-Bug: #1442154

commit_message:
Fix style of app tiles

* Now all tiles have same size.
* App name replaces with ellipsis is it's too long.
* App name is shown on mouse enter in case of overflow.


Change-Id: Ic9a86211a2af13e72027895764071457cc21cb56
Closes-Bug: #1439294

commit_message:
Tag all Swift packages

Some users wish to override the default package provider by their own.

Tag all packages with the 'openstack' to allow mass resource attributes
override using resource collectors.

Change-Id: Ib0cec660f134e266006f41572cafcc4661ca1e67
Closes-bug: #1391209
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2417, 'name': 'Ben Swartzlander', 'email': 'ben@swartzlander.org', 'username': 'bswartz'}, {'_account_id': 6116, 'name': 'li,chen', 'email': 'shchenli@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'chen-li'}, {'_account_id': 6491, 'name': 'xing-yang', 'email': 'xingyang105@gmail.com', 'username': 'xing-yang'}, {'_account_id': 7652, 'name': 'Luis Pab√≥n', 'email': 'lpabon@gmail.com', 'username': 'lpabon'}, {'_account_id': 8851, 'name': 'Valeriy Ponomaryov', 'email': 'kiparis.kh@gmail.com', 'username': 'vponomaryov'}, {'_account_id': 11047, 'name': 'Mark Sturdevant', 'email': 'mark.sturdevant@ibm.com', 'username': 'markstur'}, {'_account_id': 11865, 'name': 'Clinton Knight', 'email': 'cknight@netapp.com', 'username': 'cknight'}, {'_account_id': 14232, 'name': 'Igor Malinovskiy', 'email': 'u.glide@gmail.com', 'username': 'imalinovskiy'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-09 20:27:13.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/glusterfs_native.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/test_glusterfs_native.py'], 'message': 'glusterfs_native: Fix Gluster command call

In the delete_snapshot API, the Gluster command issued to delete the
snapshot ends up being run in the interactive mode of the
Gluster-CLI. So instead of an XML output, the command results in a
Gluster-CLI read error. Fix this by forcing the Gluster command to be
run in the script mode.

Change-Id: Ic09f59732bf08942a9d216f70f1fc969d9ae0a2d
Closes-Bug: #1442339
'}]
commit_message:
glusterfs_native: Fix Gluster command call

In the delete_snapshot API, the Gluster command issued to delete the
snapshot ends up being run in the interactive mode of the
Gluster-CLI. So instead of an XML output, the command results in a
Gluster-CLI read error. Fix this by forcing the Gluster command to be
run in the script mode.

Change-Id: Ic09f59732bf08942a9d216f70f1fc969d9ae0a2d
Closes-Bug: #1442339

commit_message:
glusterfs, glusterfs_native: perform version checks

- add gluster_version method to GlusterManager class
- gluster: check if version of the GlusterFS server is at least 3.5
- gluster_native: check if version of the GlusterFS server is at least 3.6
- gluster_native: on snaphot creation failure, interpret errno only
  for GlusterFS strictly later than 3.6

Change-Id: I242ea83c3a31670eb6a13c11e39d0c2228170c50
Closes-Bug: #1417352

Closes-Bug: #1441602
'}]
commit_message:
Add object caching in manila REST API requests

Allow the core API to cache resources, such as DB results, so that
extensions can use data already retrieved within the same API request
eliminating additional expensive DB calls.

Loosely based on Cinder commits 233430b51ddbd207f22eee98386ffbb766fd777f
and 4aeb7256ef4cc75bae4ff9258a5bcf6092b3c834. Which are based on Nova
commit 9f9fbc54e7336da10fc3056bdaca2ec7d01c7f94

Use caching for share types to avoid concurrency issue when listing of
share types request was getting response from another request.

Change-Id: I8bb3d9af0ee36d0c7b80f979ef1ce6eafb2f6ced
Closes-Bug: #1441602

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-02 13:27:06.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_vmware_volumeops.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/vmdk.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/volumeops.py', 'cinder/tests/test_vmware_vmdk.py'], 'message': 'VMware: Fix missing target resource pool

The volume is cloned while creating it from another volume, snapshot
or image. Currently, the target resource pool is unset while calling
vCenter CloneVM_Task API.

So when a clone happens across clusters in a vCenter clone fails.
This patch fixes the problem by setting the target resource pool
(returned by datastore selection logic) while invoking clone.

Closes-Bug: #1416456

Change-Id: Ib1023efe6fd19d604af89f7e4b4f67640d778d39
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Fix missing target resource pool

The volume is cloned while creating it from another volume, snapshot
or image. Currently, the target resource pool is unset while calling
vCenter CloneVM_Task API.

So when a clone happens across clusters in a vCenter clone fails.
This patch fixes the problem by setting the target resource pool
(returned by datastore selection logic) while invoking clone.

Closes-Bug: #1416456

Change-Id: Ib1023efe6fd19d604af89f7e4b4f67640d778d39

subject: Mock out base share driver __init__ in EMC driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-10 20:15:46.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/emc/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Mock out base share driver __init__ in EMC driver

Two EMC driver unit tests failed because it failed to load Neutron
network plugins. This is because stevedore.extension.ExtensionManager
is mocked to return [] for the EMC parent driver (EMC parent driver
uses stevedore framework to load backend plugins such as VNX and
Isilon), however, the base share driver tries to load Neutron network
plugins and expects the list to be non-empty.

This patch mocks out the base share driver __init__ method so that
it will not try to initialize the base class and will not try to
load the Neutron network plugin.

Change-Id: I57ff71f638b48c1485b32401addc909002fdc768
Closes-Bug: #1442788
'}]
commit_message:
Mock out base share driver __init__ in EMC driver

Two EMC driver unit tests failed because it failed to load Neutron
network plugins. This is because stevedore.extension.ExtensionManager
is mocked to return [] for the EMC parent driver (EMC parent driver
uses stevedore framework to load backend plugins such as VNX and
Isilon), however, the base share driver tries to load Neutron network
plugins and expects the list to be non-empty.

This patch mocks out the base share driver __init__ method so that
it will not try to initialize the base class and will not try to
load the Neutron network plugin.

Change-Id: I57ff71f638b48c1485b32401addc909002fdc768
Closes-Bug: #1442788

subject: Add murano environments to murano datasource tables and fix bugs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-08 22:04:48.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datasources/murano_classes.py', 'congress/tests/datasources/test_murano_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/murano_driver.py'], 'message': "Add murano environments to murano datasource tables and fix bugs

Includes environment in the parent_types and relationships
datasource tables. Also fixes a bug where parent_types entries of
an application/service are missing if its type prefix is not
'io.murano.apps' as in the case of MySql ('io.murano.databases.mysql')
Now service type is checked against loaded application packages so
that the service type is properly identified. If its type is not
found then its type prefix is used for identifying its type as the
last resort.

Implements: blueprint murano-driver

Change-Id: I9b5fcbade1398678238ac6b470d4eccdd1ffc893
"}]
commit_message:
Add murano environments to murano datasource tables and fix bugs

Includes environment in the parent_types and relationships
datasource tables. Also fixes a bug where parent_types entries of
an application/service are missing if its type prefix is not
'io.murano.apps' as in the case of MySql ('io.murano.databases.mysql')
Now service type is checked against loaded application packages so
that the service type is properly identified. If its type is not
found then its type prefix is used for identifying its type as the
last resort.

Implements: blueprint murano-driver

Change-Id: I9b5fcbade1398678238ac6b470d4eccdd1ffc893

commit_message:
Track modals in dependency graph of agnostic policy engine

This change adds a datastructure that keeps track of the tables
that exist for each modal in the head of rules.

The motivating use case is setting up triggers for implementing
explicit reactive enforcment.

The MemcachedBackend class doesn't act like a normal Manager since

commit_message:
Refactor MemcachedBackend to not be a Manager

The MemcachedBackend class doesn't act like a normal Manager since
it doesn't use the superclass to import the driver. All it did is
forward item references to the driver, but this is obvious and easy
enough to implement locally. Making MemcachedBackend not subclass
from Manager makes subclasses of Manager consistent.

bp stevedore

Change-Id: I1d865220e8225bf7a9a1b016eea1d364c70ed832

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-01 23:48:48.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/neutron.rb'], 'message': 'Reduce neutron API timeout to 10 seconds

If the neutron server is down, 120 seconds is far too long to wait for
puppet to fail. This patch reduces the timeout to 10 seconds because if
the neutron server is flaky, but not down, 10 seconds is a reasonable
amount of time to retry connecting.

Change-Id: I7bd694d1e5ee3477f7ea862965f7f3368903abde
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce neutron API timeout to 10 seconds

If the neutron server is down, 120 seconds is far too long to wait for
puppet to fail. This patch reduces the timeout to 10 seconds because if
the neutron server is flaky, but not down, 10 seconds is a reasonable
amount of time to retry connecting.

Change-Id: I7bd694d1e5ee3477f7ea862965f7f3368903abde

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Show volume device name

When setting a volume, allow setting the volume device name if supported

Note: To test, you need to add the following to local_settings.py

REST_API_REQUIRED_SETTINGS = ['OPENSTACK_HYPERVISOR_FEATURES']

OPENSTACK_HYPERVISOR_FEATURES = {
    'can_set_mount_point': True
}

Change can_set_mount_point to False to see it not show up.
Must restart the server.

Co-Authored-By: Brian Tully <brian.tully@hp.com>
Change-Id: Ied8b1e92ea361fa5806128a71d6815e4b1494272
Closes-Bug: #1439906

subject: Rename notifier 'listeners' to 'topics'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-08 23:21:53.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/types/notifier.py'], 'message': "Rename notifier 'listeners' to 'topics'

This variable is better renamed to 'topics' to
match the typical message queue kind of syntax/usage since
each entry in this dictionary is nearly equivalent to a
specific topic channel about a event (with the dictionary
value being the set of targets/listeners that are registered
on that channel who will get notified about any channel/topic
activity).

Change-Id: Ie76e9cc4e29f4e542be987561cd6872e021cfa58
"}]
commit_message:
Rename notifier 'listeners' to 'topics'

This variable is better renamed to 'topics' to
match the typical message queue kind of syntax/usage since
each entry in this dictionary is nearly equivalent to a
specific topic channel about a event (with the dictionary
value being the set of targets/listeners that are registered
on that channel who will get notified about any channel/topic
activity).

Change-Id: Ie76e9cc4e29f4e542be987561cd6872e021cfa58

commit_message:
Updates Heat template Compose and Kolla Repositories

Previously, compose was being pulled from sdake. Since pull 1011
for pid=host support was merged, we can now use the upstream repo.

Additionally, the heat template was using the Kolla ml-3 release.
Since ml3 was cut, trunk should be reverted to using Kolla trunk.

Change-Id: I44ad01ee9fde914c87d981c05b825fa549420f8c

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Settings for volume name

This patch provides the rest API needed to
get settings that allow conditionally
displaying the volume device name
and admin password.

Examples:

settingsService.ifEnabled('setting').then(doThis);
settingsService.ifEnabled('setting', 'expected', 'default').then(doThis, elseThis);

Change-Id: I8d16f4b974786157c5aa562e2675e6e60aabc412
Partial-Bug: #1439906
Partial-Bug: #1439905

commit_message:
Add Functional Tests for Private Key Secret Type

Add two functional tests that generate secrets from
two different libraries (OpenSSL and PyCrypto).  Prove
that each generated private key can be stored, retreived,
consumed, and have the result match the original.

Change-Id: Ifac00999cf36945d79371ffb8152fdf31efe9585

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-04-10 12:16:37.000000000', 'files': ['projects/90_ironic/settings', 'functions', 'grenade.sh', 'projects/50_neutron/settings', 'projects/40_glance/settings', 'projects/70_cinder/settings', 'inc/upgrade', 'projects/20_ceilometer/settings', 'projects/60_nova/settings', 'projects/10_keystone/settings'], 'message': "modularize mysql db saving

let projects declare that they will have a database to be saved, and
we'll do it for them, in the mysql case. Eventually other saving
issues should be left to per project save-state.sh scripts.

services which aren't always enabled in grenade jobs have their
settings files guarded with conditionals. Eventually we'll do
conditional loading of these settings files, however for now this lets
the rest of the infrastructure around running actions based on

commit_message:
modularize mysql db saving

let projects declare that they will have a database to be saved, and
we'll do it for them, in the mysql case. Eventually other saving
issues should be left to per project save-state.sh scripts.

services which aren't always enabled in grenade jobs have their
settings files guarded with conditionals. Eventually we'll do
conditional loading of these settings files, however for now this lets
the rest of the infrastructure around running actions based on
PLUGIN_DIRS and UPGRADE_SERVICES be *non* conditional, which
simplifies them.

Change-Id: I06cad95ca319e4403772e5fb394c0f8965e0bf9d

commit_message:
always install the exit trap in scripts

This moves the exit trap into grenade/functions, which means all
grenade scripts will get the exit trap registered on them. This also
adds stack tracing into the scripts so that we can determine where we
were when we failed.

Change-Id: I4100628180498ff8723a1af6c0a4c10b4d8244c8

subject: reorder imports in stand alone scripts
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-04-09 18:28:29.000000000', 'files': ['save-state', 'upgrade-tempest', 'clean.sh', 'check-sanity', 'stop-base'], 'message': 'reorder imports in stand alone scripts

$GRENADE_DIR/functions pulls in devstack functions, and needs
$GRENADE_DIR/grenaderc to be sourced first. Do this for all affected
scripts.

stop-base also needs the grenade.settings file as that handles all the
partial services.

reorder clean.sh to remove warnings

Change-Id: I5baa17783abe0c235691d88e484331c7960549f9
'}]
commit_message:
reorder imports in stand alone scripts

$GRENADE_DIR/functions pulls in devstack functions, and needs
$GRENADE_DIR/grenaderc to be sourced first. Do this for all affected
scripts.

stop-base also needs the grenade.settings file as that handles all the
partial services.

reorder clean.sh to remove warnings

Change-Id: I5baa17783abe0c235691d88e484331c7960549f9

commit_message:
Shorten HTTP request timeout length

If a service is really not available and not just in the middle of
refreshing, it will be apparent relatively quickly. There is no need to
have the user wait 120 seconds to fail. This patch decreases the
timeout length to 10 seconds.

Change-Id: Ia9e13bd6c6f867b00f0a14ccff86cb3ab52f9fe3
(cherry picked from commit eb4f43e25cc40160980bf1fc45a48e1abe147d65)

commit_message:
Merge baremetal_nodes func tests between V2 and V2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges baremetal_nodes functional tests.

Change-Id: Ifb42121727ae8ad1eebbdff3e52f2af816ccae28

commit_message:
Rename TOSCA AttachTo relationship

The AttachTo relationship name has been changed to AttachesTo per the latest
TOSCA spec to be consistent with naming like BindsTo, ConnectsTo etc.

Change-Id: Ibd0e0232a06b02c494def452755422ab94c4024e

commit_message:
Shorten HTTP request timeout length

If a service is really not available and not just in the middle of
refreshing, it will be apparent relatively quickly. There is no need to
have the user wait 120 seconds to fail. This patch decreases the
timeout length to 10 seconds.

Change-Id: Ia9e13bd6c6f867b00f0a14ccff86cb3ab52f9fe3

external processes and respawn them when them get killed

subject: Use a sentinel connection pool to manage failover
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-25 14:01:45.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/redis.py'], 'message': "Use a sentinel connection pool to manage failover

When configured to use sentinel with the redis driver, allow the
redis-py client to manage the connection to the currently elected
master.

'master_for' will return a StricRedis client which is bound to a
connection pool that queries the Sentinel[s] when providing
connections from the pool.

This means that failover handling is automatic as long as the
sentinels can be reached and they have elected a new master.

Change-Id: I8fd672e664d98097944a7c984cadab5fb08dd2d6
Closes-Bug: #1434043
(cherry picked from commit 54d6bb1c94270d2794ecefbcaf3f8832010e3d58)
"}]
commit_message:
Use a sentinel connection pool to manage failover

When configured to use sentinel with the redis driver, allow the
redis-py client to manage the connection to the currently elected
master.

'master_for' will return a StricRedis client which is bound to a
connection pool that queries the Sentinel[s] when providing
connections from the pool.

This means that failover handling is automatic as long as the
sentinels can be reached and they have elected a new master.

Change-Id: I8fd672e664d98097944a7c984cadab5fb08dd2d6
Closes-Bug: #1434043
(cherry picked from commit 54d6bb1c94270d2794ecefbcaf3f8832010e3d58)

commit_message:
Updating the disk image builder code

Adds haproxy 1.5.x from ubuntu trusty backports
Adds a git pull for the amphora agent code
Removes check for argparse (internal for python 2.7)
Adds sysctl net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind=1

Change-Id: I7aecf727fb5d9be08982c5a32ae3c6e280ebda14

subject: Fix caching bug in create_volume/list_volume
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-07 01:25:47.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_shade.py', 'shade/__init__.py'], 'message': "Fix caching bug in create_volume/list_volume

We need to respect the 'cache' flag passed in to list_volumes, but we
were ignoring it.

This causes problems if a volume moves from 'creating' to 'available',
so adding a test to make sure that works.

Change-Id: I5d2c36b4402cd099f3d7810feccd76693b786f76
"}]
commit_message:
Fix caching bug in create_volume/list_volume

We need to respect the 'cache' flag passed in to list_volumes, but we
were ignoring it.

This causes problems if a volume moves from 'creating' to 'available',
so adding a test to make sure that works.

Change-Id: I5d2c36b4402cd099f3d7810feccd76693b786f76

commit_message:
Apply a naming rule of GET to orchestration client

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to orchestration client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I5a0d046d3811d48d3e4bddae8b0f022762c621c8

commit_message:
Apply a naming rule of GET to volume client

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to volume client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I843dd43293f40bf673a033b1dbf24e035bc8f0c3

commit_message:
Change domain_id FK in project table

This patch partially implements Reseller.
Previous patches did:

- Honor domain operations in project table
- Stop calling domain drivers

This patch update the Fk to domain_id in the Project Table
that before pointed to the Domain Table and now will point
to the Project table.

Change-Id: I8ab47ec961362c8420a97617c4fb17a349fcc6a3
Implements: bp reseller

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 6062, 'name': 'jichenjc', 'email': 'jichenjc@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jichenjc'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8574, 'name': 'Qin Zhao', 'username': 'zhaoqin', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11103, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'otc_cloud@163.com', 'username': 'intelotccloud', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12175, 'name': 'Eli Qiao', 'email': 'qiaoliyong@gmail.com', 'username': 'Eli'}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-23 16:30:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/block_device_mapping.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_block_device.py', 'nova/block_device.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': 'Release bdm constraint source and dest type

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1377958 fixed a problem
that source_type: image, destination_type: local is not
supported for boot instance, exception should be raised to
reject the param otherwise it will lead to instance become
ERROR state.

However the fix introduced a problem on nova client
https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-novaclient/+bug/1418484
The fix of the bug leads to following command become invalid

nova boot test-vm --flavor m1.medium --image centos-vm-32
--nic net-id=c3f40e33-d535-4217-916b-1450b8cd3987 --block-device
id=26b7b917-2794-452a-95e5-2efb2ca6e32d,bus=sata,source=volume,bootindex=1

So we need to release the original constraint to allow
the above special case pass the validation check then
we can revert the nova client exception
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/165932/)

This patch checks the boot_index and whether image param is
given after we found the bdm has source_type: image,
destination_type: local, if this is the special case, then
no exception will be raised.

Closes-Bug: #1433609

Change-Id: If43faae95169bc3864449a8364975f5c887aac14
'}]
commit_message:
Release bdm constraint source and dest type

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1377958 fixed a problem
that source_type: image, destination_type: local is not
supported for boot instance, exception should be raised to
reject the param otherwise it will lead to instance become
ERROR state.

However the fix introduced a problem on nova client
https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-novaclient/+bug/1418484
The fix of the bug leads to following command become invalid

nova boot test-vm --flavor m1.medium --image centos-vm-32
--nic net-id=c3f40e33-d535-4217-916b-1450b8cd3987 --block-device
id=26b7b917-2794-452a-95e5-2efb2ca6e32d,bus=sata,source=volume,bootindex=1

So we need to release the original constraint to allow
the above special case pass the validation check then
we can revert the nova client exception
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/165932/)

This patch checks the boot_index and whether image param is
given after we found the bdm has source_type: image,
destination_type: local, if this is the special case, then
no exception will be raised.

Closes-Bug: #1433609

Change-Id: If43faae95169bc3864449a8364975f5c887aac14

commit_message:
Removes a Keyring support section from End User Guide

As keyring encryption support was removed from openstackclient code,
the End User Guide was updated as well by removing Keyring support
section from appropriate chapter in the user guide.

Change-Id: I9531b460be9a4dd2d6c1aedb33324fd9140a4538
Closes-Bug: #1419990

revisions:

This will make the django dashboard log in /mnt/state/var/log/horizon
as it happens already for other components.

The django logging dict is appended into local_settings.py only if

The logging settings are taken from the defaults found in the

Change-Id: Idd957ae4ff5f71a5949dc8703bd29398b32c4498

commit_message:
add INFO level logging for the django dashboard

This will make the django dashboard log in /mnt/state/var/log/horizon
as it happens already for other components.

The django logging dict is appended into local_settings.py only if
no lines defining the logging are found to be there already.

The logging settings are taken from the defaults found in the
local_settings.py.example file shipped with horizon.

Change-Id: Idd957ae4ff5f71a5949dc8703bd29398b32c4498

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-10 14:06:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix check_can_live_migrate_destination() in ComputeV4Proxy

There was a mismatch in the V4 proxy in the call signatures of this
function. This was missed because the "destination" parameter is passed
in the rpcapi as the host to contact, which is consumed by the rpc
layer and not passed. Since it was not called one of the standard
names (either host if to be not passed, or host_param if to be passed),
this was missed.

Change-Id: Idf2160934dade650ed02b672f3b64cb26247f8e6
Closes-Bug: #1442602
'}]
commit_message:
Fix check_can_live_migrate_destination() in ComputeV4Proxy

There was a mismatch in the V4 proxy in the call signatures of this
function. This was missed because the "destination" parameter is passed
in the rpcapi as the host to contact, which is consumed by the rpc
layer and not passed. Since it was not called one of the standard
names (either host if to be not passed, or host_param if to be passed),
this was missed.

Change-Id: Idf2160934dade650ed02b672f3b64cb26247f8e6
Closes-Bug: #1442602

commit_message:
CloudFoundry deployment fixes

On some environments, especially on small instances
with slow internet connection deployment may fail.

In this change:
- Added retry procedure.
- Adjusted timeouts.
- Improved logging.

Change-Id: Ic0dbe73b5d7a90c1de86ffa0029a0fefd029b15b

commit_message:
Refactored github tools to prefer token-based auth

The github workflow still asks for username, password,
and 2FA token if need be, but creates a repo token and
uses that for further exchanges to save on user input
fatigue.

Closes-Bug: #1442764

Change-Id: I530a965dc5d5bad080c49b5cf0d38f3f7aee201a

commit_message:
Share V2 and V2.1 tenant-networks functional tests

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges tenant-networks functional tests.

Change-Id: I470ce6d26cd0865d2645ef269aa419b2b200ac37

Closes-Bug: #1430522

commit_message:
Default app status to REGISTERED

If an app is new or simply owns no assemblies, display a status
of REGISTERED instead of an empty list. This also helps convey
that creating (registering) an app does not immediately invoke
the test/build/deploy process.

Closes-Bug: #1430522

Change-Id: I24aa0170a0228ed6e097203edb3cb76101745260

subject: Doc updates for Certificates for PKI
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-29 17:02:29.000000000', 'files': ['doc/common/section_keystone_certificates-for-pki.xml'], 'message': 'Doc updates for Certificates for PKI

There were several issuses with the "Certificates for PKI"
subsection of the "Identity management" section of the Cloud
Administrator Guide.

- Keystone doesn't have a token_format or ca_password setting in
  the [signing] section of its config file, so the doc shouldn't
  say that there is one.

- Keystone does have a cert_subject option, so add that for
  completeness.

- The token provider class is now used instead of token_format.

Change-Id: Id8fe05797948e107d5fdb1e781eb40046c293872
'}]
commit_message:
Doc updates for Certificates for PKI

There were several issuses with the "Certificates for PKI"
subsection of the "Identity management" section of the Cloud
Administrator Guide.

- Keystone doesn't have a token_format or ca_password setting in
  the [signing] section of its config file, so the doc shouldn't
  say that there is one.

- Keystone does have a cert_subject option, so add that for
  completeness.

- The token provider class is now used instead of token_format.

Change-Id: Id8fe05797948e107d5fdb1e781eb40046c293872

subject: MariaDB bind on correct address
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-10 17:07:02.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp', 'controller.yaml', 'puppet/controller-puppet.yaml'], 'message': "MariaDB bind on correct address

Despite passing bind-address for MariaDB in overcloud_controller.pp
correctly, it was always trying to bind on 0.0.0.0. The problem is
caused by Galera's config file (we install Galera into the image even
though we don't use it yet). Galera's default config file contains
override of the bind-address value to 0.0.0.0, and the setting from
galera.cnf took precendence over what was in server.cnf.

The mariadb-galera-server package assumes that the main config happens
in galera.cnf and it ships an almost empty server.cnf. We now have an
EnableGalera param, when it's set to true the mysql module will manage
galera.cnf instead of server.cnf, overriding the default values from
galera.cnf and fixing the issue.

Change-Id: I7c2fd41d41dcf5eb4ee8b1dbd74d60cc2cabeed9
Closes-Bug: #1442256"}]
commit_message:
MariaDB bind on correct address

Despite passing bind-address for MariaDB in overcloud_controller.pp
correctly, it was always trying to bind on 0.0.0.0. The problem is
caused by Galera's config file (we install Galera into the image even
though we don't use it yet). Galera's default config file contains
override of the bind-address value to 0.0.0.0, and the setting from
galera.cnf took precendence over what was in server.cnf.

The mariadb-galera-server package assumes that the main config happens
in galera.cnf and it ships an almost empty server.cnf. We now have an
EnableGalera param, when it's set to true the mysql module will manage
galera.cnf instead of server.cnf, overriding the default values from
galera.cnf and fixing the issue.

Change-Id: I7c2fd41d41dcf5eb4ee8b1dbd74d60cc2cabeed9
Closes-Bug: #1442256

commit_message:
Merge sec grp default rules tests between V2 and V2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges sec grp default rules functional tests.

Change-Id: I3a00d86c3c5451473601bd330015ccef4cf5c2a2

commit_message:
Share migrations tests between V2 and V2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges migrations functional tests.

Change-Id: Iae29b8df04b43cc3b8cf56c1f51d73b62c7ca2bc
