revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-26 17:24:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_dvrscheduler_db.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', 'neutron/db/l3_agentschedulers_db.py'], 'message': 'Removes router binding with router-interface-delete

Today when an interface is deleted from a dvr router
the binding with the l3-agent is not removed for the
qrouter.

This patch will try to remove the binding with all
the l3 agents for the specific router if there are
no other subnets attached to the router.

This will also trigger the agent to remove the
namespaces if configured to do so.

Change-Id: I29a2e3009114728b96429939804fcc7f3cb25281
Closes-Bug: #1413630
'}]
commit_message:
Removes router binding with router-interface-delete

Today when an interface is deleted from a dvr router
the binding with the l3-agent is not removed for the
qrouter.

This patch will try to remove the binding with all
the l3 agents for the specific router if there are
no other subnets attached to the router.

This will also trigger the agent to remove the
namespaces if configured to do so.

Change-Id: I29a2e3009114728b96429939804fcc7f3cb25281
Closes-Bug: #1413630

subject: Fix test_as_root* tests to work when run as root
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-10 14:56:27.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_processutils.py'], 'message': "Fix test_as_root* tests to work when run as root

While using docker to test this module, I discovered that the
test suite does not pass because the processutils.execute() code
will not prepend the root helper because it already has root
permissions, which results in the shell trying to execute the
command 'a b c', rather than 'echo a b c'.

Change-Id: Id3429f06d6a0353f1cc4520af6daceed48c30071
"}]
commit_message:
Fix test_as_root* tests to work when run as root

While using docker to test this module, I discovered that the
test suite does not pass because the processutils.execute() code
will not prepend the root helper because it already has root
permissions, which results in the shell trying to execute the
command 'a b c', rather than 'echo a b c'.

Change-Id: Id3429f06d6a0353f1cc4520af6daceed48c30071

commit_message:
Fix s3_token middleware parsing insecure option

The "insecure" option was being treated as a bool when it was
actually provided as a string. The fix is to parse the string to
a bool.

Closes-Bug: 1411063
Change-Id: I508dae8d7bedfc903e476cdefac43d05cbd7fbe1

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-06 16:51:52.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Make (check|gate)-tempest-dsvm-full-ceph voting for cinder/glance/nova

The ceph job has been passing on master for awhile except for when
test_volume_boot_pattern was enabled again which has problems with a
ceph backend. There is a Tempest change to skip that test when using
ceph until the bug is fixed, but we'd like to get the ceph job voting so
we don't regress it further with new changes.

This also makes the job voting on glance changes since it's configured
to use the rbd store in glance so we don't want glance changes
regressing it either.

Depends-On: Ia1cba598a8243dd4a48613c870a25de578b79fe4

Change-Id: Ia68cb013818f26bed093dbf8a989e74d7c6f8cac
"}]
commit_message:
Make (check|gate)-tempest-dsvm-full-ceph voting for cinder/glance/nova

The ceph job has been passing on master for awhile except for when
test_volume_boot_pattern was enabled again which has problems with a
ceph backend. There is a Tempest change to skip that test when using
ceph until the bug is fixed, but we'd like to get the ceph job voting so
we don't regress it further with new changes.

This also makes the job voting on glance changes since it's configured
to use the rbd store in glance so we don't want glance changes
regressing it either.

Depends-On: Ia1cba598a8243dd4a48613c870a25de578b79fe4

Change-Id: Ia68cb013818f26bed093dbf8a989e74d7c6f8cac

subject: Make the ceph jobs fetch an image-based cirros and use it by default
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-01 21:36:52.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "Make the ceph jobs fetch an image-based cirros and use it by default

Cinder (ceph driver) bug 1439371 means that UEC images don't work for
boot-from-volume with ceph. This works around that problem by using an
actual image (which we probably should be doing more of, given that it
is likely a more common scenario for many deployments).

Change-Id: I201b89a3da92d8df18d0db30b9664ba4fadd5a9c
"}]
commit_message:
Make the ceph jobs fetch an image-based cirros and use it by default

Cinder (ceph driver) bug 1439371 means that UEC images don't work for
boot-from-volume with ceph. This works around that problem by using an
actual image (which we probably should be doing more of, given that it
is likely a more common scenario for many deployments).

Change-Id: I201b89a3da92d8df18d0db30b9664ba4fadd5a9c

subject: Get whole resource type instead of resource type ID
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-02 06:23:02.000000000', 'files': ['glance/db/sqlalchemy/metadata.py'], 'message': 'Get whole resource type instead of resource type ID

Update metadefs broke db export_metadefs command. It raises
NoSuchColumnError. This is because _get_resource_type method
returns only resource type ID instead of whole resource type.
To fix this issue _get_resource_type should return all resource
type columns from DB.

Change-Id: I375aaae7b4439027501f4f09d413cb607d2461b7
Closes-Bug: #1439221
'}]
commit_message:
Get whole resource type instead of resource type ID

Update metadefs broke db export_metadefs command. It raises
NoSuchColumnError. This is because _get_resource_type method
returns only resource type ID instead of whole resource type.
To fix this issue _get_resource_type should return all resource
type columns from DB.

Change-Id: I375aaae7b4439027501f4f09d413cb607d2461b7
Closes-Bug: #1439221

subject: Change proposals fall back on proposed branches
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-10 14:40:10.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/propose_update.sh'], 'message': "Change proposals fall back on proposed branches

During the RC period for a project, there may already be a stable
branch for the release on the triggering project and a proposed
branch on the target project. If so, we want stable changes proposed
to the proposed branch. That's not confusing!

Change-Id: I488bb9ff63daf9d012e41dbaa178b1656eaeffad
"}]
commit_message:
Change proposals fall back on proposed branches

During the RC period for a project, there may already be a stable
branch for the release on the triggering project and a proposed
branch on the target project. If so, we want stable changes proposed
to the proposed branch. That's not confusing!

Change-Id: I488bb9ff63daf9d012e41dbaa178b1656eaeffad

commit_message:
Temporarily remove dashboard

The dashboard package is currently not installable because its
dependency info isn't current (doesn't work with Kilo packages). We need
to remove it from controller image to unblock TripleO CI. It can be
re-added when we have a working dashboard package.

Change-Id: Iccc708664b1c018d8712d99de755ef43351635a6

commit_message:
Merge instance_usage_audit_log tests between V2 and V2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges instance_usage_audit_log functional tests.

Change-Id: I08bca29e48fdf00f02d77f5332a93c2db14a3551

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-10 16:07:47.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/test_images.py', 'ironic/common/grub_conf.template'], 'message': "Fix for automated boot iso issue with IPA ramdisk

Autogenerated boot iso for iscsi_ilo driver fails when
Fedora based IPA ramdisk is used for deploy in UEFI boot mode.
The keywords used (linux and initrd) in grub.cfg template are
specific to Ubuntu only. They are not recognized by Fedora.
Have changed it to keywords (linuxefi and initrdefi) which are
recognized by both Ubuntu and Fedora deploy ramdisks.

Also the menuentry name has been changed to 'boot_partition' in
grub config file. This is done to make it consistent with pxe
driver's elilo config file wherein menuentry name for the final
boot of user image is 'boot_partition'.

Closes-Bug: 1441691

Change-Id: Ia6fdbf4868e6606a18b33ce2b75f29f701a31b35
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for automated boot iso issue with IPA ramdisk

Autogenerated boot iso for iscsi_ilo driver fails when
Fedora based IPA ramdisk is used for deploy in UEFI boot mode.
The keywords used (linux and initrd) in grub.cfg template are
specific to Ubuntu only. They are not recognized by Fedora.
Have changed it to keywords (linuxefi and initrdefi) which are
recognized by both Ubuntu and Fedora deploy ramdisks.

Also the menuentry name has been changed to 'boot_partition' in
grub config file. This is done to make it consistent with pxe
driver's elilo config file wherein menuentry name for the final
boot of user image is 'boot_partition'.

Closes-Bug: 1441691

Change-Id: Ia6fdbf4868e6606a18b33ce2b75f29f701a31b35

commit_message:
Merging instance_actions tests between V2 and V2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges instance_actions functional tests.

Change-Id: I0773458cdeeca2f1eeac19d579cb8228769e1e18

commit_message:
Tests use common base class

By using a common base class, it's easy to (either permanently or
for testing) add a check that gets put on all Keystone tests.

Change-Id: I903d839a719ca49e7baea51756e13cc8ac2b0749

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-07 19:43:11.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/hacking/checks.py', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': 'Correct cinder hacking check numbering

We have a couple of hacking checks that are specific to
Cinder that were written a while back.  Unfortunately, when
they were written the numbering scheme for hacking checks was
not understood.  We used N3xx when we should have used C3xx.

This patch corrects that mistake.

Change-Id: Ia17797005d444ab53a45b47b80b97799114001ee
Closes-bug: 1440833
'}]
commit_message:
Correct cinder hacking check numbering

We have a couple of hacking checks that are specific to
Cinder that were written a while back.  Unfortunately, when
they were written the numbering scheme for hacking checks was
not understood.  We used N3xx when we should have used C3xx.

This patch corrects that mistake.

Change-Id: Ia17797005d444ab53a45b47b80b97799114001ee
Closes-bug: 1440833

commit_message:
execute: enforce C locale unless explicitly requested

A bug in our dnsmasq version checker [1] raised a question whether we
actually want to run any external services using locales that are
different from C. Assuming it's better to be safe than sorry, let's
enforce C locale.

Removed local LC_ALL setting for dnsmasq check since now it's global.

The patch allows execute() callers to override the new default by
passing 'LC_ALL' with their addl_env.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/149524/

Related-Bug: #1412738
Change-Id: If6992f7a598743aaa87f6fe5ee4e1c5b2b32ccd4

subject: Generate docs for constructor
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-31 01:06:02.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Generate docs for constructor

The docs for the class constructor parameters for several
classes weren't rendered because they were on the __init__
method, which sphinx doesn't render. When the docs are generated
for the class the __init__ parameters are shown after the class
name, so the parameters should be documented on the class where
they'll be rendered rather than on __init__.

Change-Id: I674ff76495aa4b30273083201f365bce790f447e
"}]
commit_message:
Generate docs for constructor

The docs for the class constructor parameters for several
classes weren't rendered because they were on the __init__
method, which sphinx doesn't render. When the docs are generated
for the class the __init__ parameters are shown after the class
name, so the parameters should be documented on the class where
they'll be rendered rather than on __init__.

Change-Id: I674ff76495aa4b30273083201f365bce790f447e

migration scripts is created not correctly the exception arise
before to go in production.

Change-Id: I1654ae33709f77e187da6a12f6a58009ac79a39f

commit_message:
Add database-server and database-server-ha.

This makes it possible to build controllers with either
MariaDB or Galera. The default is to use MariaDB, but
we can easily swap in Galera for CI (or as a default)
if needed too by using the database-server-ha element
instead.

Change-Id: I1654ae33709f77e187da6a12f6a58009ac79a39f

commit_message:
Share V2 and V2.1 hosts functional tests

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges all hosts functional tests.

Change-Id: Ibd53a7ddd4792942fe2dc45121dcc25fc9864903

better off on the more stable juno for the moment.

Change-Id: I4cc0a4a0ea6b2d9d546b6e3147215b35ff5d818a

commit_message:
Add admin GW with metric for Neutron-enabled environments

It's required for nodes which are deployed before VIPs are up
and in case of multiple L2 segments.

Related-Bug: #1437842
Related-Bug: #1442078

Change-Id: Ib128ff4fab57bca34473e6ae25cd461c08133702

In some systems, setup.py may put neutron-rootwrap in some other path,
so let's just allow sudo and shell to locate it.

Change-Id: Ic2b5986436689cb3a71c1be560fba5971fea50f2
"}]
commit_message:
Allow sudo to determine neutron-rootwrap location

In some systems, setup.py may put neutron-rootwrap in some other path,
so let's just allow sudo and shell to locate it.

Change-Id: Ic2b5986436689cb3a71c1be560fba5971fea50f2

subject: Fix db-sync dependencies
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-10 14:46:17.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/server.pp'], 'message': 'Fix db-sync dependencies

W/o this change, some config changes could
be not synced to db and neutron-server service
start not aligned with db sync process

The solution is to fix the dependencies for
Neutron_config stanzas before db sync exec
and for n-server service - after db sync

Closes-bug: #1384133

Change-Id: I769b6e7ddb567a21a91eeb77375213c131a3d396
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit d7c8d2327a0d46a79ca6519762f088efa8e7373a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix db-sync dependencies

W/o this change, some config changes could
be not synced to db and neutron-server service
start not aligned with db sync process

The solution is to fix the dependencies for
Neutron_config stanzas before db sync exec
and for n-server service - after db sync

Closes-bug: #1384133

Change-Id: I769b6e7ddb567a21a91eeb77375213c131a3d396
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit d7c8d2327a0d46a79ca6519762f088efa8e7373a)

subject: Make neutron_plugin_ml2 before db-sync
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-10 14:47:16.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/plugins/ml2.pp'], 'message': 'Make neutron_plugin_ml2 before db-sync

W/o this change some of config changes for
ml2 plugin could be not synced to db.

Solution is to add a notify on db-sync
for all Neutron_plugin_ml2 stanzas

Closes-bug: #1384119

Change-Id: I23f6bca99e1c077804011897814649419da326d4
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 53688bf2b26682474427f31202756d3217ff20f5)
'}]
commit_message:
Make neutron_plugin_ml2 before db-sync

W/o this change some of config changes for
ml2 plugin could be not synced to db.

Solution is to add a notify on db-sync
for all Neutron_plugin_ml2 stanzas

Closes-bug: #1384119

Change-Id: I23f6bca99e1c077804011897814649419da326d4
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 53688bf2b26682474427f31202756d3217ff20f5)

subject: Remove UUIDs from RST pot files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-10 08:18:18.000000000', 'files': ['tools/generatepot-rst.sh'], 'message': "Remove UUIDs from RST pot files

We do not need the UUIDs for our toolchain, remove them.

They cause huge changes with each import with no benefit for us.

Note: Sphinx 1.3 by default disables UUID generation but we're using an
older Sphinx version for building, thus have to do this manually.

Change-Id: I3f3e910c5b2a2d03a3f04b67015526c3b7e77ddb
"}]
commit_message:
Remove UUIDs from RST pot files

We do not need the UUIDs for our toolchain, remove them.

They cause huge changes with each import with no benefit for us.

Note: Sphinx 1.3 by default disables UUID generation but we're using an
older Sphinx version for building, thus have to do this manually.

Change-Id: I3f3e910c5b2a2d03a3f04b67015526c3b7e77ddb

The quantitative and qualitative\n  assessment start from tracking actions across all OpenStack git\n  repositories, gerrit code reviews, bug trackers as well as IRC channels,\n  mailing lists and questions/answers.\n\nCo-author: Stefano Maffulli\nChange-Id: Ie3afdf0c8941d21896aa60dbf9d1cbd6593b5a7f\n"}]
commit_message:
OpenStack Community Activity Report Q1 2015

  This report is produced quarterly to give Community Managers
  and OpenStack Foundation's management better insights on development
  activities and online conversations. The quantitative and qualitative
  assessment start from tracking actions across all OpenStack git
  repositories, gerrit code reviews, bug trackers as well as IRC channels,
  mailing lists and questions/answers.

Co-author: Stefano Maffulli
Change-Id: Ie3afdf0c8941d21896aa60dbf9d1cbd6593b5a7f

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-09 21:52:38.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': "Specify network UUID for network create with cells

When the n-cell service is enabled, we create networks in both the
API cell and the child cell. Recent changes to tempest have tests
querying networks from the API and passing them for a server create.
In order for this to work in cells, the UUIDs for the network in
the API cell and the child cell must match, else the network won't
be found in the child.

This change adds the --uuid option to the nova-manage network create
command for cells only.

Related-Bug: #1441931

Change-Id: Ib5933b1405c0761ff727e04cda0c502a826c8eaf

commit_message:
Specify network UUID for network create with cells

When the n-cell service is enabled, we create networks in both the
API cell and the child cell. Recent changes to tempest have tests
querying networks from the API and passing them for a server create.
In order for this to work in cells, the UUIDs for the network in
the API cell and the child cell must match, else the network won't
be found in the child.

This change adds the --uuid option to the nova-manage network create
command for cells only.

Related-Bug: #1441931

Depends-On: Ib29e632b09905f557a7a6910d58207ed91cdc047

Change-Id: Ib5933b1405c0761ff727e04cda0c502a826c8eaf

commit_message:
Merge certificates functional tests of v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges certificates functional tests.

Change-Id: I3439eb50bf5d64f2101681dc523def9c586f893d

subject: Allow overriding ensure for glance-registry
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-10 14:38:12.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/registry.pp', 'spec/classes/glance_registry_spec.rb'], 'message': "Allow overriding ensure for glance-registry

The main glance class allows overriding the package_ensure setting
from the default of 'present', but on Debian based systems
glance-registry is a separate package.  This package updates the
glance::registry class to allow overriding the package ensure there
also.

Change-Id: I6182836728102e827f9d5a3beef4964dd6e8d7f9
(cherry picked from commit 9befc700a1b086b6f81fbb959a4c7520e83be5ad)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow overriding ensure for glance-registry

The main glance class allows overriding the package_ensure setting
from the default of 'present', but on Debian based systems
glance-registry is a separate package.  This package updates the
glance::registry class to allow overriding the package ensure there
also.

Change-Id: I6182836728102e827f9d5a3beef4964dd6e8d7f9
(cherry picked from commit 9befc700a1b086b6f81fbb959a4c7520e83be5ad)

commit_message:
Removing python 2.6 support

Python 2.6 is no longer supported in Django >= 1.7 or by OpenStack
as of Kilo. Additionally, the versions of django_openstack_auth are
all capped on the stable branches, so this will not effect them.

Change-Id: I75fc4a0ba090eb0d10cda235a1deb75f734ab1c7

Fix API/Registry ensure for Ubuntu

On Ubuntu the API and Registry are separate packages so we need an
package_ensure for each.

Change-Id: Ib9015e5020a86ece6a38eadb4d1a3900be29b139

commit_message:
Removing py26 from django_openstack_auth in Kilo

django_openstack_auth needs to support newer versions of Django.
Starting Django 1.7, python 2.6 is no longer supported. Removing
python-26 jobs from django_openstack_auth gate for builds other
than Juno and Icehouse.

Change-Id: Ib9015e5020a86ece6a38eadb4d1a3900be29b139

commit_message:
Merge V2 and V2.1 Agent functional tests

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges Agent functional tests.

Change-Id: Ibfbe20f6c0b773ec7cf39d532074075c722deb63

subject: Revert 'Remove image to local block device mapping'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-19 17:22:10.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/servers.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': "Revert 'Remove image to local block device mapping'

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/153203/3 added check
for novaclient, removed the logic for both
--image and --block-device are added.

But actually the following valid boot command failed
due to the change here, so this patch reverted original
one and add some descriptions to avoid further removal.

nova boot test-vm --flavor m1.medium --image centos-vm-32
--nic net-id=c3f40e33-d535-4217-916b-1450b8cd3987
--block-device id=26b7b917-2794-452a-95e5-2efb2ca6e32d,bus=sata,
source=volume,bootindex=1

Change-Id: Ia29e63c72b34d3038aa591c466425e65edf5755b
Partial-Bug: #1433609
"}]
commit_message:
Revert 'Remove image to local block device mapping'

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/153203/3 added check
for novaclient, removed the logic for both
--image and --block-device are added.

But actually the following valid boot command failed
due to the change here, so this patch reverted original
one and add some descriptions to avoid further removal.

nova boot test-vm --flavor m1.medium --image centos-vm-32
--nic net-id=c3f40e33-d535-4217-916b-1450b8cd3987
--block-device id=26b7b917-2794-452a-95e5-2efb2ca6e32d,bus=sata,
source=volume,bootindex=1

Change-Id: Ia29e63c72b34d3038aa591c466425e65edf5755b
Partial-Bug: #1433609

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-07 13:54:03.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/registry.pp', 'spec/classes/glance_registry_spec.rb'], 'message': "Allow overriding ensure for glance-registry

The main glance class allows overriding the package_ensure setting
from the default of 'present', but on Debian based systems
glance-registry is a separate package.  This package updates the
glance::registry class to allow overriding the package ensure there
also.

Change-Id: I6182836728102e827f9d5a3beef4964dd6e8d7f9

commit_message:
Allow overriding ensure for glance-registry

The main glance class allows overriding the package_ensure setting
from the default of 'present', but on Debian based systems
glance-registry is a separate package.  This package updates the
glance::registry class to allow overriding the package ensure there
also.

Change-Id: I6182836728102e827f9d5a3beef4964dd6e8d7f9

subject: Notify services if swift.conf is modified
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-10 12:45:10.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/proxy.pp', 'manifests/storage/generic.pp', 'manifests/storage/container.pp', 'manifests/storage/account.pp', 'manifests/storage/object.pp'], 'message': 'Notify services if swift.conf is modified

swift.conf contains the hash_suffix. With the current module, we have a
race condition where services can start *before* having the right hash
in swift.conf, so some objects mays be put in quarantine.

When usint swift_config (which affect swift.conf), we should restart all
services to ensure our ring is running correctly.

Change-Id: I1087ba4ec079ca9c43bea9ff0511347632871ec2
Closes-bug: #1442329
(cherry picked from commit 6dc85b0f7918fa295974f7afbb1a6b8a26f8f953)
'}]
commit_message:
Notify services if swift.conf is modified

swift.conf contains the hash_suffix. With the current module, we have a
race condition where services can start *before* having the right hash
in swift.conf, so some objects mays be put in quarantine.

When usint swift_config (which affect swift.conf), we should restart all
services to ensure our ring is running correctly.

Change-Id: I1087ba4ec079ca9c43bea9ff0511347632871ec2
Closes-bug: #1442329
(cherry picked from commit 6dc85b0f7918fa295974f7afbb1a6b8a26f8f953)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-31 23:24:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/fake_notifier.py'], 'message': "Add serialization of context to FakeNotifier

Currently, the FakeNotifier doesn't do anything to check the context
that will be serialized when the RPC call is made. This change adds
a call to serialize the context to prevent bugs related to the
context passed in to send the notification.

Related-Bug: #1360911

Change-Id: I905f8421bc8e34c52b779d65a88d1ebf044f4dd1
"}]
commit_message:
Add serialization of context to FakeNotifier

Currently, the FakeNotifier doesn't do anything to check the context
that will be serialized when the RPC call is made. This change adds
a call to serialize the context to prevent bugs related to the
context passed in to send the notification.

Related-Bug: #1360911

Change-Id: I905f8421bc8e34c52b779d65a88d1ebf044f4dd1

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-15 14:53:45.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/helpers.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/ml2/test_helpers.py', 'neutron/common/exceptions.py'], 'message': "Use 'FOR UPDATE' in allocate_partially_specified_segment

The allocate_partially_specified_segment fails to allocate
a segment if a concurrent process already allocated it.

The method tries to retry the allocation, but instead of trying a
different segment it tries with same segment id multiple times.

The issue could be addressed by iterating over the first select result
set instead of reissuing the same select on old database view, in this
case the retry limit should not be a hard-coded (10) and we should consume
the full result set before give up.

The 'FOR UPDATE' way does not affected by the `old database view` issue,
it can be applied without a retry loop.

The deadlock free allocation on bulk allocation cannot
be guaranteed without ensuring all allocator in all process
uses the same ordering.

Instead of pretending it easily can be done, extending the method
documentation with a possible DBDeadlock exception.

Change-Id: I58837fd132ffaa9d443137b5fc100ac9fc9caabb
Closes-Bug: #1410854
"}]
commit_message:
Use 'FOR UPDATE' in allocate_partially_specified_segment

The allocate_partially_specified_segment fails to allocate
a segment if a concurrent process already allocated it.

The method tries to retry the allocation, but instead of trying a
different segment it tries with same segment id multiple times.

The issue could be addressed by iterating over the first select result
set instead of reissuing the same select on old database view, in this
case the retry limit should not be a hard-coded (10) and we should consume
the full result set before give up.

The 'FOR UPDATE' way does not affected by the `old database view` issue,
it can be applied without a retry loop.

The deadlock free allocation on bulk allocation cannot
be guaranteed without ensuring all allocator in all process
uses the same ordering.

Instead of pretending it easily can be done, extending the method
documentation with a possible DBDeadlock exception.

Change-Id: I58837fd132ffaa9d443137b5fc100ac9fc9caabb
Closes-Bug: #1410854

commit_message:
Forbid the user to specify custom ports during creating docker-apps

At the moment there is no mechanism to change container port for
application. Thus, we shouldn't allow the user to specify custom
ports apart from cases when application requires explicit network
configuration and ports must be specified as environment variables

Change-Id: I9382478765d6b40142b3723e0bed050d48f1da4a
Closes-Bug: #1442154

commit_message:
exc_filters: support for ForeignKey error on delete

The current code only supports this type of constraint on INSERT, this
adds support for DELETE.

Change-Id: I981eb5f7b71bd37a35a93bbd3fada01d74aba12d
Closes-Bug: #1439358

subject: Add pyngus to requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-10 06:59:20.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Add pyngus to requirements

oslo.messaging use pyngus for the one of its functionnal job (amqp1).

This python module is not in the requirement of oslo.messaging
because it can't be build on ubuntu trusty due to a missing c library
qpid-proton, and because the driver is experimental and can be run only
on fedora >= 21 for now, so the installation of it have been hardcoded
in devstack for fedora to allow gating on this driver.

Since all python modules installed via pip are now checked against
global-requirements we must have this deps here.

This change does that.

Closes-bug: #1442488

Change-Id: I91a7655becc4d559e3928b67cf70586cdaf42a29
"}]
commit_message:
Add pyngus to requirements

oslo.messaging use pyngus for the one of its functionnal job (amqp1).

This python module is not in the requirement of oslo.messaging
because it can't be build on ubuntu trusty due to a missing c library
qpid-proton, and because the driver is experimental and can be run only
on fedora >= 21 for now, so the installation of it have been hardcoded
in devstack for fedora to allow gating on this driver.

Since all python modules installed via pip are now checked against
global-requirements we must have this deps here.

This change does that.

Closes-bug: #1442488

Change-Id: I91a7655becc4d559e3928b67cf70586cdaf42a29

commit_message:
Move entry points for plugin agents into neutron.cmd.eventlet

This patch moves entry points for the following plugins:

- bigswitch
- cisco
- hyperv
- ibm
- linuxbridge
- nec
- oneconvergence
- openvswitch
- sriovnicagent

This allows us to remove explicit monkey_patch() call.

Also removed ability to execute agents from the tree without utilizing
entry points since it's not supported.

Related-Bug: #1418541
Change-Id: I2a57e4f497f33306dda1060f6dce5458e3ba68fa

subject: Update ssh module version
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-10 13:24:05.000000000', 'files': ['metadata.json', '.fixtures.yml'], 'message': "Update ssh module version

The ssh module had an issue with hostkeys on RHEL systems prior to
version 2.4.0 that would cause puppet to error during a run: the
sshdsakey fact returns empty, so the exported dsa sshkey resource fails
due to an empty parameter[1]. The current dependency restricts the ssh
module to less than 2.0, which contains the bug.

Problematically, version 2.5.0 of the ssh module adds a change that is
incompatible with older 3.x versions of puppet [2], which breaks our tests.

This patch updates the ssh dependency to use full range of the next
major version in order to be as accomodating as possible. However, for
RHEL users to avoid the ssh key bug, they must use at least version
2.4.0. For users of older puppet versions to avoid the bad parameter
issue, they must use a version less than 2.5.0. The .fixtures.yml pins
to 2.4.0 for maximum compatibility. We could pin the dependency in the
metadata to exactly 2.4.0 as well, but since these are issues in the
ssh module, not swift's use of the ssh module, it is more appropriate
just to allow the newer version but not be too restrictive on the
version.

The ssh::server class has an API change between 1.x and 2.x, but the
new parameters (ensure, storeconfigs_enabled, and an options hash) have
acceptable defaults.

[1] https://github.com/saz/puppet-ssh/blob/v1.4.0/manifests/hostkeys.pp#L8
[2] https://github.com/saz/puppet-ssh/blob/v2.5.0/manifests/server/install.pp#L7

Change-Id: I30216b0336b5f1f1c65e711cb97654ef663ba01f
(cherry picked from commit 7ad2a10e1fd5f78a6632cf76c8def3ae4559677e)
"}]
commit_message:
Update ssh module version

The ssh module had an issue with hostkeys on RHEL systems prior to
version 2.4.0 that would cause puppet to error during a run: the
sshdsakey fact returns empty, so the exported dsa sshkey resource fails
due to an empty parameter[1]. The current dependency restricts the ssh
module to less than 2.0, which contains the bug.

Problematically, version 2.5.0 of the ssh module adds a change that is
incompatible with older 3.x versions of puppet [2], which breaks our tests.

This patch updates the ssh dependency to use full range of the next
major version in order to be as accomodating as possible. However, for
RHEL users to avoid the ssh key bug, they must use at least version
2.4.0. For users of older puppet versions to avoid the bad parameter
issue, they must use a version less than 2.5.0. The .fixtures.yml pins
to 2.4.0 for maximum compatibility. We could pin the dependency in the
metadata to exactly 2.4.0 as well, but since these are issues in the
ssh module, not swift's use of the ssh module, it is more appropriate
just to allow the newer version but not be too restrictive on the
version.

The ssh::server class has an API change between 1.x and 2.x, but the
new parameters (ensure, storeconfigs_enabled, and an options hash) have
acceptable defaults.

[1] https://github.com/saz/puppet-ssh/blob/v1.4.0/manifests/hostkeys.pp#L8
[2] https://github.com/saz/puppet-ssh/blob/v2.5.0/manifests/server/install.pp#L7

Change-Id: I30216b0336b5f1f1c65e711cb97654ef663ba01f
(cherry picked from commit 7ad2a10e1fd5f78a6632cf76c8def3ae4559677e)

Update ssh module version

The ssh module had an issue with hostkeys on RHEL systems prior to
version 2.4.0 that would cause puppet to error during a run: the
sshdsakey fact returns empty, so the exported dsa sshkey resource fails
due to an empty parameter[1]. The current dependency restricts the ssh
module to less than 2.0, which contains the bug.

Problematically, version 2.5.0 of the ssh module adds a change that is
incompatible with older 3.x versions of puppet [2], which breaks our tests.

This patch updates the ssh dependency to use full range of the next
major version in order to be as accomodating as possible. However, for
RHEL users to avoid the ssh key bug, they must use at least version
2.4.0. For users of older puppet versions to avoid the bad parameter

to 2.4.0 for maximum compatibility. We could pin the dependency in the
metadata to exactly 2.4.0 as well, but since these are issues in the
ssh module, not swift's use of the ssh module, it is more appropriate
just to allow the newer version but not be too restrictive on the
version.

The ssh::server class has an API change between 1.x and 2.x, but the
new parameters (ensure, storeconfigs_enabled, and an options hash) have
acceptable defaults.

[1] https://github.com/saz/puppet-ssh/blob/v1.4.0/manifests/hostkeys.pp#L8
[2] https://github.com/saz/puppet-ssh/blob/v2.5.0/manifests/server/install.pp#L7

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-31 22:34:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py'], 'message': 'Handle nova-network tuple format in legacy RPC calls

The NetworkRequestList object renders tuples differently depending on
network manager. When falling back to older RPC APIs we are missing
the special casing for the nova network, causing things to blow
up during icehouse->juno partial upgrades when specifying a network
with during instance spawn.

Change-Id: I792f64aa5cbbe9666505d1c7958796c771d4aff2
Closes-bug: #1438920
'}]
commit_message:
Handle nova-network tuple format in legacy RPC calls

The NetworkRequestList object renders tuples differently depending on
network manager. When falling back to older RPC APIs we are missing
the special casing for the nova network, causing things to blow
up during icehouse->juno partial upgrades when specifying a network
with during instance spawn.

Change-Id: I792f64aa5cbbe9666505d1c7958796c771d4aff2
Closes-bug: #1438920

commit_message:
Add logging to dangling port to ml2 delete_subnet

This is useful when trouble shooting test failures.
Also, in db_base_plugin_v2, log only port_id instead of
full allocation object.

Related-Bug: #1357055

commit_message:
Add version to support_status where it omitted

This improve doc notes about deprecated objects
and adds option 'version' to all objects with
support_status parameter.

blueprint deprecating-improvements

commit_message:
Avoid re-using the same timeout for further watcher ops

Instead of re-using the same timeout that is passed into the
'run_watchers' function we should adjust that timeout after
each fetch so that the expected timeout the user gives to this
function is observed.

Change-Id: I5d171b1ac8b207213224f4e0f3909625de7275db
(cherry picked from commit e38a29f67180cb40a0b7915305bec62ed9527229)

subject: Notify services if swift.conf is modified
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-09 21:03:12.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/proxy.pp', 'manifests/storage/generic.pp', 'manifests/storage/container.pp', 'manifests/storage/account.pp', 'manifests/storage/object.pp'], 'message': 'Notify services if swift.conf is modified

swift.conf contains the hash_suffix. With the current module, we have a
race condition where services can start *before* having the right hash
in swift.conf, so some objects mays be put in quarantine.

When usint swift_config (which affect swift.conf), we should restart all
services to ensure our ring is running correctly.

Change-Id: I1087ba4ec079ca9c43bea9ff0511347632871ec2
Closes-bug: #1442329
'}]
commit_message:
Notify services if swift.conf is modified

swift.conf contains the hash_suffix. With the current module, we have a
race condition where services can start *before* having the right hash
in swift.conf, so some objects mays be put in quarantine.

When usint swift_config (which affect swift.conf), we should restart all
services to ensure our ring is running correctly.

Change-Id: I1087ba4ec079ca9c43bea9ff0511347632871ec2
Closes-bug: #1442329

commit_message:
provide explicit defaults for boolean values

When creating a neutron_network resource without explicitly setting the
router_external parameter, the network would be created with
router:external=True, which would result in a network to which it was
not possible to attach nova instances.

This change sets explicit defaults for all boolean options in the
neutron_network type.

Closes-bug: 1436133
Change-Id: Id0f950da791c65ba9034046177870f31f6f57c46

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 105, 'name': 'Kyle Mestery', 'email': 'mestery@mestery.com', 'username': 'mestery'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10980, 'name': 'Doug Wiegley', 'email': 'dougwig@parkside.io', 'username': 'dougw'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-12 11:25:23.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron', 'lib/neutron_plugins/services/vpn', 'lib/neutron_plugins/services/firewall'], 'message': "neutron: make l3/vpn agent use config-dir

Now that advanced services are split from the core tree, there are no
guarantees that any auxiliary configuration files are installed on the
system.

In devstack, it's handled by dynamically generating list of CLI
arguments based on which services are enabled in local.conf. This
approach is not applicable for distributions though where those
arguments are usually hardcoded in a service manifest.

Distributions will need to switch to using an approach that is more
dynamic. oslo.config provides us with an option to replace --config-file
arguments with --config-dir, that would load all *.conf files from
there. That would allow distributions to keep the same arguments no
matter which services are installed on a system.

This patch applies the same approach to devstack installations since
it's expected to be the way to go forward.

In this patch, I'm assuming that VPN agent cannot be used on the same
node as L3 agent. If that's not the case, we may need to maintain two
separate conf-dirs.

Note: we're leaving actual configuration files in their old paths, we
only create symbolic links to point to them from the configuration
directory.

Closes-Bug: #1431292
Depends-On: I072f35100737f4f139f647b508a22b45d40f13fc
Change-Id: I84fc20c4b6f58c2ae75bb1be226dcd783f81832e
"}]
commit_message:
neutron: make l3/vpn agent use config-dir

Now that advanced services are split from the core tree, there are no
guarantees that any auxiliary configuration files are installed on the
system.

In devstack, it's handled by dynamically generating list of CLI
arguments based on which services are enabled in local.conf. This
approach is not applicable for distributions though where those
arguments are usually hardcoded in a service manifest.

Distributions will need to switch to using an approach that is more
dynamic. oslo.config provides us with an option to replace --config-file
arguments with --config-dir, that would load all *.conf files from
there. That would allow distributions to keep the same arguments no
matter which services are installed on a system.

This patch applies the same approach to devstack installations since
it's expected to be the way to go forward.

In this patch, I'm assuming that VPN agent cannot be used on the same
node as L3 agent. If that's not the case, we may need to maintain two
separate conf-dirs.

Note: we're leaving actual configuration files in their old paths, we
only create symbolic links to point to them from the configuration
directory.

Closes-Bug: #1431292
Depends-On: I072f35100737f4f139f647b508a22b45d40f13fc
Change-Id: I84fc20c4b6f58c2ae75bb1be226dcd783f81832e

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-12 13:39:23.000000000', 'files': ['upgrade-neutron', 'from-juno/upgrade-neutron', 'from-icehouse/upgrade-neutron'], 'message': 'neutron: generate config-dir for L3/VPN agent

Fill in the directory with symbolic links to enabled configuration
values, so that devstack can use --config-dir= argument instead of
multiple --config-file arguments when starting L3/VPN agent.

Note that the change is not mandatory for all distributions, so no
specific release notes are required. Distributions can mimic the
approach that we take with the patch in their service manifests on their
own schedule.

Change-Id: I072f35100737f4f139f647b508a22b45d40f13fc
Closes-Bug: #1431292
'}]
commit_message:
neutron: generate config-dir for L3/VPN agent

Fill in the directory with symbolic links to enabled configuration
values, so that devstack can use --config-dir= argument instead of
multiple --config-file arguments when starting L3/VPN agent.

Note that the change is not mandatory for all distributions, so no
specific release notes are required. Distributions can mimic the
approach that we take with the patch in their service manifests on their
own schedule.

Change-Id: I072f35100737f4f139f647b508a22b45d40f13fc

commit_message:
Keep history of updated resource attributes

This change keeps history of updated resource attributes
by creating a new row in resource_history tables each time the
resource table is updated.

Each resource extension table also gains a '<resource_name>_history' to
track its history too.

Change-Id: If532b5167f0bbecb94f15594f0227c537ed26f77

commit_message:
Handle CHECK constraint integrity in PostgreSQL

PostgreSQL offers CHECK constraints integrity which are currently raised
as generic error. This patch add a filter so they can have their own
exception type.

Change-Id: I7e36ef4385b227d1e62e18277d470047a369a238

subject: Add filters for DBDataError exception
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-09 14:51:21.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/exception.py', 'oslo_db/sqlalchemy/exc_filters.py', 'oslo_db/tests/old_import_api/sqlalchemy/test_exc_filters.py'], 'message': "Add filters for DBDataError exception

We currently don't distinguish DB errors, that are due to problems
with the processed data (like division by zero, numeric value out
of range, incorrect data type passed, etc)

This actually led to a problem when MySQL threw two different errors
depending on the randomly generated UUID value and we wrapped only
one of those cases properly, which caused the test case to fail time
to time in the gate.

Closes-Bug: #1442178

Change-Id: I02891f3b1ede6f33834e5637be43496499cc88e7
"}]
commit_message:
Add filters for DBDataError exception

We currently don't distinguish DB errors, that are due to problems
with the processed data (like division by zero, numeric value out
of range, incorrect data type passed, etc)

This actually led to a problem when MySQL threw two different errors
depending on the randomly generated UUID value and we wrapped only
one of those cases properly, which caused the test case to fail time
to time in the gate.

Closes-Bug: #1442178

Change-Id: I02891f3b1ede6f33834e5637be43496499cc88e7

revisions:
[{'number': 32, 'created': '2015-03-30 18:38:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/cells/test_cells_weights.py', 'nova/cells/weights/mute_child.py'], 'message': "Scheduler: deprecate mute_weight_value option on weigher

The nova.cells.weights.mute_child.MuteChildWeigher used a large
mute_weight_value flag to inflate the weigher's value. This was needed
before weight normalization was in place, so that the weigher could win
against other weighers. Now, with weight normalization in place this is
not needed any more, since the maximum value that a weigher would take will
be 1.0 (weights are normalized between 0.0 and 1.0). We should use the
multiplier to get the same behavior (i.e. make the weigher prevail
against other weighers), the multiplier has been also increased so
that it actually mutes the other weighers an does not break backwards
compatibility.

DocImpact: The mute_weight_value has been marked as deprecated so the
operators need to adjust the mute_weight_multiplier to a proper value if
they weren't using the defaults.

Closes-Bug: #1340068
Change-Id: Idebd7649909567034b01ce04416ce315fb936b17
"}]
commit_message:
Scheduler: deprecate mute_weight_value option on weigher

The nova.cells.weights.mute_child.MuteChildWeigher used a large
mute_weight_value flag to inflate the weigher's value. This was needed
before weight normalization was in place, so that the weigher could win
against other weighers. Now, with weight normalization in place this is
not needed any more, since the maximum value that a weigher would take will
be 1.0 (weights are normalized between 0.0 and 1.0). We should use the
multiplier to get the same behavior (i.e. make the weigher prevail
against other weighers), the multiplier has been also increased so
that it actually mutes the other weighers an does not break backwards
compatibility.

DocImpact: The mute_weight_value has been marked as deprecated so the
operators need to adjust the mute_weight_multiplier to a proper value if
they weren't using the defaults.

Closes-Bug: #1340068
Change-Id: Idebd7649909567034b01ce04416ce315fb936b17

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-07 11:28:27.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_alarm_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/alarms.py'], 'message': "limit alarm actions

Currently we have alarm quotas, but user still can create a single
alarm with thousands of actions, the worse thing is that normal
user can create log:// and test:// notifiers which they could never
use it, but by doing such thing, normal user can break down ceilometer
services, then maybe the whole server. That is because log:// will
log to local disk (by default) and test:// will continuously consume
server's memory.

This patch adds a configure option to let cloud administrator to
limit each alarm's maximum actions for three states, and disables
normal user to create log:// and test:// to avoid bad things happen.

Change-Id: I7325ab72c94d307075f1317ee0b7b19f30a5d231
Closes-Bug: #1408248
DocImpact
"}]
commit_message:
limit alarm actions

Currently we have alarm quotas, but user still can create a single
alarm with thousands of actions, the worse thing is that normal
user can create log:// and test:// notifiers which they could never
use it, but by doing such thing, normal user can break down ceilometer
services, then maybe the whole server. That is because log:// will
log to local disk (by default) and test:// will continuously consume
server's memory.

This patch adds a configure option to let cloud administrator to
limit each alarm's maximum actions for three states, and disables
normal user to create log:// and test:// to avoid bad things happen.

Change-Id: I7325ab72c94d307075f1317ee0b7b19f30a5d231
Closes-Bug: #1408248
DocImpact

commit_message:

commit_message:
libvirt: reuse unfilter_instance pass-through method

The libvirt driver already has an unfilter_instance() method that calls
firewall_driver.unfilter_instance().

This change updates a couple of other places in the driver that are
calling firewall_driver.unfilter_instance() directly to use the
pass-through method.

Change-Id: I93dc9415e0c7e2a0b9e400bcb564b1a6256c9032

commit_message:
Forbid setting is_public via querystring

All package parameters are specified via json body.
Before there was an undocumented ability to set 'is_public' via
querystring. This patch removes this exception and updates respective
tests

Change-Id: Idb284ca1af2902abcc19da112da9024bbbd28fc6
Closes-Bug: #1441125

registered in Keystone

subject: WIP: Low-level object undelete functionality
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-24 10:47:42.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'etc/swift.conf-sample', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'WIP: Low-level object undelete functionality

WIP: for discussion, needs some documentation updates too.

Currently each object DELETE is executed immediately, making it hard to
impossible to recover from unintentional object deletes. As an operator I would
like have a more failsafe approach to this, for example to undelete objects in a
short period of time after deletion. This might be useful to recover from
external application bugs or abused authentication credentials.

This patch adds a new configuration option to etc/swift.conf making it possible
to change the default behavior. If keep-deleted-object is set to True each
object deletion is not unlinking the object file directly, but moving it to a
"deleted_objects" directory on the disk. This makes the operation fast (it is
basically only a rename), and these files are not handled anymore by internal
Swift processes. This also means that these deleted object files are no longer
replicated or audited.

Note that only the last object .data and .meta file is kept, this patch
explicitly does not keep multiple versions of the same object.

Operators need to remove older files files frequently, for example using a
command like this:

find -L /srv/ -type f -name "*.deleted" -mtime +24 -exec rm {} \;

Object undeletion has to be done manually with this patch; however it is quite
easy to add a more sophisticated approach as an additional object server
middleware later.

Change-Id: If03adc8d73455b1b3b213a694b894b0ba9c5ece1
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Low-level object undelete functionality

WIP: for discussion, needs some documentation updates too.

Currently each object DELETE is executed immediately, making it hard to
impossible to recover from unintentional object deletes. As an operator I would
like have a more failsafe approach to this, for example to undelete objects in a
short period of time after deletion. This might be useful to recover from
external application bugs or abused authentication credentials.

This patch adds a new configuration option to etc/swift.conf making it possible
to change the default behavior. If keep-deleted-object is set to True each
object deletion is not unlinking the object file directly, but moving it to a
"deleted_objects" directory on the disk. This makes the operation fast (it is
basically only a rename), and these files are not handled anymore by internal
Swift processes. This also means that these deleted object files are no longer
replicated or audited.

Note that only the last object .data and .meta file is kept, this patch
explicitly does not keep multiple versions of the same object.

Operators need to remove older files files frequently, for example using a
command like this:

find -L /srv/ -type f -name "*.deleted" -mtime +24 -exec rm {} \;

Object undeletion has to be done manually with this patch; however it is quite
easy to add a more sophisticated approach as an additional object server
middleware later.

Change-Id: If03adc8d73455b1b3b213a694b894b0ba9c5ece1

commit_message:
Add hacking check for print() statements

We are frequently having to -1 patches because people
forget print() statements that were used for debug in
their development.  Can save everyone time and trouble by
adding this simple hacking check.

The check excluded the cinder/cmd directory as the files in there
legitimately need to use the print() command.  Also wsgi.py and
the test_hds_nas_backend.py files make use of print, so I have
excluded those from checking as well.

Change-Id: I2066eeb2bdc6c9af294d0b9befb7e0b32abd1378

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-09 23:10:56.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_schedulers.py', 'neutron/db/l3_agentschedulers_db.py'], 'message': 'Return from check_ports_exist_on_l3agent if no subnet found

The call to get_subnet_ids_on_router can return an empty list.
If the subnet_ids list is empty, the subsequent call to get
the ports on a subnet returns all ports.  If this occurs
when doing a remove_router_interface, the performance
of a remove_router_interface degrades significantly.  This change
returns immediately from check_ports_exist_on_l3agents if no
subnet is found.  A new unit test has been added to cover

Closes-Bug: #1420032
Depends-On: I15bbf16fd4378c6431e9da8942d0968e7a012a91
(cherry picked from commit 760fe6a8fabc921e75367b5f02bab4fc326b8115)
'}]
commit_message:
Return from check_ports_exist_on_l3agent if no subnet found

The call to get_subnet_ids_on_router can return an empty list.
If the subnet_ids list is empty, the subsequent call to get
the ports on a subnet returns all ports.  If this occurs
when doing a remove_router_interface, the performance
of a remove_router_interface degrades significantly.  This change
returns immediately from check_ports_exist_on_l3agents if no
subnet is found.  A new unit test has been added to cover
the specific case of returning immediately without calling
get_ports when a remove_router_interface operation is performed.

This allows the DVR job on stable/juno to go back to normal.

Conflicts:
        neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_schedulers.py

Tracking requests across multiple OpenStack services is difficult.

commit_message:
Log Request ID Mappings

Tracking requests across multiple OpenStack services is difficult.
This is a proposal for logging corresponding request IDs together, so users
can easily lookup the request IDs of services other than the one the user
called directly.

blueprint log-request-id-mappings

Change-Id: Ie0089fa5006c7dc2b81a2bc3700b8728ed9700f6
Previously-approved: juno

commit_message:
Introduce Pacemaker driver for the servicegroup.

Apart of providing servicegroup information just like the other drivers, it'll
be also able to provide other information, like host status in reliable way.

subject: Do not re-elect RabbitMQ multistate resource master
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-07 13:33:46.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nova/files/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': "Do not re-elect RabbitMQ multistate resource master

Current monitor action for multistate RabbitMQ resource
in Pacemaker  may re-elect existing master when there is
no need to do so. That is a problem as master elections
introduce full cluster downtime and we don't want
additional elections.

The fix is to check whether the given node uptime is equal
to the other nodes uptime and drop this node from the list
of candidates if there is a master exists. Note, there is a
special 'rabbit-master' attribute in CIB for this.

Closes-bug: #1435254

Change-Id: I6f2484fb8f3284f76461c184148d27aa86a5d4b6
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Do not re-elect RabbitMQ multistate resource master

Current monitor action for multistate RabbitMQ resource
in Pacemaker  may re-elect existing master when there is
no need to do so. That is a problem as master elections
introduce full cluster downtime and we don't want
additional elections.

The fix is to check whether the given node uptime is equal
to the other nodes uptime and drop this node from the list
of candidates if there is a master exists. Note, there is a
special 'rabbit-master' attribute in CIB for this.

Closes-bug: #1435254

Change-Id: I6f2484fb8f3284f76461c184148d27aa86a5d4b6
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

subject: Support the detection and alarm of orphans
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-12-12 03:51:27.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/approved/support-orphans-manage.rst'], 'message': "Support the detection and alarm of orphans

In existing OpenStack cluster, there are some orphans on many compute node,
these orphans consumes a lot of resources, but the OpenStack can not manage
these orphans, and also can't timely detection and notify the user to clean up,
so I think that the nova should be able to manage these orphans, and can notify
the admin or user to process it.

Change-Id: I935aff27d8c5e3a36f75f673824f0ae671845292
"}]
commit_message:
Support the detection and alarm of orphans

In existing OpenStack cluster, there are some orphans on many compute node,
these orphans consumes a lot of resources, but the OpenStack can not manage
these orphans, and also can't timely detection and notify the user to clean up,
so I think that the nova should be able to manage these orphans, and can notify
the admin or user to process it.

Change-Id: I935aff27d8c5e3a36f75f673824f0ae671845292

Today the limits API (i.e. nova absolute-limits) only returns
the project limits.  It is useful for the end user to know both
the user and project limits, especially when the end user is

capacity is available.

commit_message:
Display user and project limits

Today the limits API (i.e. nova absolute-limits) only returns
the project limits.  It is useful for the end user to know both
the user and project limits, especially when the end user is
trying to understand how much capacity is used versus how much
capacity is available.

bp user-project-limits

Change-Id: Ie2e4fa294eced7ce1147dbe377e59101af8d99f8

commit_message:
Using cinder volumes backed by VMware raw devices

OpenStack currently lacks support for attaching VMware
raw devices to Virtual machines. This blueprint allows
users to attach and detach cinder volumes backed by
VMware raw devices.

Change-Id: Icc63454cbd38d12442c48b554aba06e7c7034b58
Implements: blueprint vmware-raw-device

commit_message:
Nova trusted geo-asset tag

This spec covers how geo and asset tagging can be incorporated
to OpenStack Nova to provide location and boundary control of
workloads/OpenStack images. With Geo/Asset Tags, you can enforce
policies to control placement, migration or bursting of workloads
to trusted systems in specific geographical locations or boundaries.

Spec for https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack/?searchtext=nova-trusted-geo-asset-tag

Change-Id: I3c42769ca808aa3180c2c246e47a1ba145fe6996

commit_message:
Database purge deleted spec

This spec details the ability to cleanly purge 'deleted' rows.
This provides for confirmed data destruction, beyond the current
archive_deleted_rows functionality.

Change-Id: Icd8fa42baa9d9c78677d61b650e6e8c6460e1e84

subject: Add drivertype priority scheduling on migration
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-12-05 06:56:23.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/approved/support-driver-filter.rst'], 'message': 'Add drivertype priority scheduling on migration

In the process of live_migration, if the user does not specify the
destination, the scheduler will choose a suitable host,  but the scheduler
can not choose hosts according to the driver_type and driver_version in
the existing scheduling method, especially in a heterogeneous environment,
it will lead to the migration failure probability increased, so I think
the OpenStack as an excellent choice should be able to deal with this
situation.

Change-Id: I16851fe368a58574b183f5273da7686dd13d64f2
'}]
commit_message:
Add drivertype priority scheduling on migration

In the process of live_migration, if the user does not specify the
destination, the scheduler will choose a suitable host,  but the scheduler
can not choose hosts according to the driver_type and driver_version in
the existing scheduling method, especially in a heterogeneous environment,
it will lead to the migration failure probability increased, so I think
the OpenStack as an excellent choice should be able to deal with this
situation.

Change-Id: I16851fe368a58574b183f5273da7686dd13d64f2

subject: Volume host affinity based VM placement
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 6062, 'name': 'jichenjc', 'email': 'jichenjc@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jichenjc'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 9067, 'name': 'Nilesh Bhosale', 'email': 'nilesh.bhosale@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'nileshbhosale'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 13191, 'name': 'Smita Raut', 'email': 'smita.raut@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'smita-raut'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-11-10 07:56:08.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/approved/volume-host-affinity-based-vm-placement.rst'], 'message': "Volume host affinity based VM placement

Blueprint: volume-host-affinity-based-vm-placement

Cinder scheduler schedules volume creation on certain host based on scheduler
filters in case of multi-node setup. For local volume backends like LVM, the
volume resides locally on the host where volume create was scheduled.

There can be various use cases that leverage the volume locality information,
irrespective of cinder backend being used, and instantiate the VM closer to
where the volume resides. Data analytics based on Hadoop and MapReduce is one
of those use cases, which is elaborated in the 'Use Cases' section.

This feature will be useful with any cinder backend which uses local disks to
create a volume. And in case of cinder backends like GPFS, which uses a
clustered filesystem as cinder volume store and in normal case stripes the
volume file across disks available from various nodes in the cluster, this
feature will be useful if such backends support creating volume using disks
available from a particular node only, when indicated so.

Change-Id: I53cc43f854e4004b21838b574221c7d154bdd154
"}]
commit_message:
Volume host affinity based VM placement

Blueprint: volume-host-affinity-based-vm-placement

Cinder scheduler schedules volume creation on certain host based on scheduler
filters in case of multi-node setup. For local volume backends like LVM, the
volume resides locally on the host where volume create was scheduled.

There can be various use cases that leverage the volume locality information,
irrespective of cinder backend being used, and instantiate the VM closer to
where the volume resides. Data analytics based on Hadoop and MapReduce is one
of those use cases, which is elaborated in the 'Use Cases' section.

This feature will be useful with any cinder backend which uses local disks to
create a volume. And in case of cinder backends like GPFS, which uses a
clustered filesystem as cinder volume store and in normal case stripes the
volume file across disks available from various nodes in the cluster, this
feature will be useful if such backends support creating volume using disks
available from a particular node only, when indicated so.

Change-Id: I53cc43f854e4004b21838b574221c7d154bdd154

commit_message:
VMware:  Support multi disk images in OVA container format

When OVA support for VMware is added, this spec proposes to follow on with
adding the support for OVA images that contain multiple disk images.

Change-Id: I86330550213ad1d9c7fb7bb5dbc624529cd989e4
Implements: blueprint vmware-driver-ova-multidisk-support

None of the agents log this information, and the reason is that
it's not useful. Any errors are logged, successful state reports

is up in neutron agent-list anyway.

Change-Id: I109373129808984d34abdf6780b8cda8ca8982be
"}]
commit_message:
Remove L3 report_state logging

None of the agents log this information, and the reason is that
it's not useful. Any errors are logged, successful state reports
don't give actionable information as you can see that the agent
is up in neutron agent-list anyway.

Change-Id: I109373129808984d34abdf6780b8cda8ca8982be

subject: Do not re-elect RabbitMQ multistate resource master
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7468, 'name': 'Sergey Vasilenko', 'email': 'svasilenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'xenolog'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-07 13:30:41.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nova/files/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': "Do not re-elect RabbitMQ multistate resource master

Current monitor action for multistate RabbitMQ resource
in Pacemaker  may re-elect existing master when there is
no need to do so. That is a problem as master elections
introduce full cluster downtime and we don't want
additional elections.

The fix is to check whether the given node uptime is equal
to the other nodes uptime and drop this node from the list
of candidates if there is a master exists. Note, there is a
special 'rabbit-master' attribute in CIB for this.

Closes-bug: #1435254

Change-Id: I6f2484fb8f3284f76461c184148d27aa86a5d4b6
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Do not re-elect RabbitMQ multistate resource master

Current monitor action for multistate RabbitMQ resource
in Pacemaker  may re-elect existing master when there is
no need to do so. That is a problem as master elections
introduce full cluster downtime and we don't want
additional elections.

The fix is to check whether the given node uptime is equal
to the other nodes uptime and drop this node from the list
of candidates if there is a master exists. Note, there is a
special 'rabbit-master' attribute in CIB for this.

Closes-bug: #1435254

Change-Id: I6f2484fb8f3284f76461c184148d27aa86a5d4b6
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Smarter list_resources for history

This change creates only one query to build the history of
resources, instead of making one query for the latest version,
and another one for the previous versions.

Change-Id: I25c6ac37af5f59150cb37e8f0e89e6e13ad6d541

commit_message:
Reserve 10 migrations for backports

Reserve 10 migrations so that we have the option of backporting fixes
that include a db migration to the stable/kilo branch.  We did this
same thing to allow backports and stable/juno in
c2ce0a90e3155bae77569a285e97f2585f8a964a.

Change-Id: I1e6be551b609d1250f0d9a1078f7c22298686003

commit_message:
Fix bond parameters for l23_stored_config provider

* Parameters lacp_rate and xmit_hash_policy are not used in all bond
modes. Hence we do not write them to config file if not necessary.
* Add lacp_rate and xmit_hash_policy support for Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I4ce47af5decc544933936e2031357da6f60b4652
Closes-bug: #1436815

The idea here is to provide a way for magnum to discover and interact
with templates meant to build bays. Template definition discovery is
done through python entry_points, and each class lists the bay_types
it can provide. Each template definition contains a mapping of magnum
object attributes and heat template parameters/outputs.

This will be useful for not only allowing different CoEs, OSes, and
platforms. But can also provide the discovery mechanism for templates
once they are pulled into their own repository.

Partial-Implements: bp multiple-bay-templates

Change-Id: Ia596657856cd861c94e58dcd65acae0677a36d73
'}]
commit_message:
Add Template Definitions

The idea here is to provide a way for magnum to discover and interact
with templates meant to build bays. Template definition discovery is
done through python entry_points, and each class lists the bay_types
it can provide. Each template definition contains a mapping of magnum
object attributes and heat template parameters/outputs.

This will be useful for not only allowing different CoEs, OSes, and
platforms. But can also provide the discovery mechanism for templates
once they are pulled into their own repository.

Partial-Implements: bp multiple-bay-templates

Change-Id: Ia596657856cd861c94e58dcd65acae0677a36d73

commit_message:
Add 'yum-plugin-priorities' package

Since Fuel 6.1 we are able to work with custom set of repos with custom
priorities. By default, yum is unable to work with them, but it could be
fixed by installing 'yum-plugin-priorities'.

Change-Id: Ic41d306b4899c8ee1830f580418f812539fc22d1
Related-Bug: #1440074

commit_message:
Support for Configuration Language: Puppet

It allows for Puppet as configuration language in the execution plans.
In addition, it creates a base class (ChefPuppetExecutorBase) for
sharing common methods between Puppet and Chef executors.

Change-Id: I65ae656117aa26fc7dff4f83a2be1b4d2c3cb58b

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-31 20:30:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/console/websocketproxy.py', 'nova/tests/unit/console/test_websocketproxy.py'], 'message': 'Expand Origin header check for serial console

Serial consoles can use the ws or wss protocols which correspond to http
and https respectively from a security perspective.  The Origin header
check failed has been expanded to allow for those protocols and to match
appropriately with http/https when verifying the protocol security
level.

Change-Id: I7155607488495ba70e6edd550b12abc21b3e69c4
Closes-Bug: 1434611
'}]
commit_message:
Expand Origin header check for serial console

Serial consoles can use the ws or wss protocols which correspond to http
and https respectively from a security perspective.  The Origin header
check failed has been expanded to allow for those protocols and to match
appropriately with http/https when verifying the protocol security
level.

Change-Id: I7155607488495ba70e6edd550b12abc21b3e69c4
Closes-Bug: 1434611

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-09 16:00:53.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/commands.py'], 'message': 'OVSDB python binding should use row.delete() to remove rows

The OVS python IDL recognize a delete event when delete() is called

Change-Id: I50c94a4f089659d78f8881653cd55d4ef069cdc1
Closes-Bug: #1442217
'}]
commit_message:
OVSDB python binding should use row.delete() to remove rows

The OVS python IDL recognize a delete event when delete() is called
on the row, this should be used to remove rows from the db

Change-Id: I50c94a4f089659d78f8881653cd55d4ef069cdc1
Closes-Bug: #1442217

subject: Moving to YAQL 1.0
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-04-09 13:02:53.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/yaql_utils.py', 'mistral/exceptions.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_race_condition.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/workflow/test_direct_workflow.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_join.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_noop_task.py', 'mistral/workflow/data_flow.py', 'requirements.txt', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_direct_workflow.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/test_expressions.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_policies.py', 'mistral/expressions.py'], 'message': "Moving to YAQL 1.0

 * Fixed ProxyAwareDict according to YAQL
   convert data when evaluating expression
 * Fixed expression tests
 * Fixed Engine tests where we refer to unexisting
   variable in context
   (now YAQL raises an error when it doesn't find a
    value using given key)
 * Fixed tests on join (new way to check test correction)

 * YAQL 1.0 has its own builtin functions len() and str
   therefore our ones were deleted.
 * YAQL 1.0 uses '$.where' function instead of '$[$...]'

Implements: blueprint yaql-v1-0

Change-Id: I1b46c4e12aee6f25d1e9ca9daa1da059baf6fb68
"}]
commit_message:
Moving to YAQL 1.0

 * Fixed ProxyAwareDict according to YAQL
   convert data when evaluating expression
 * Fixed expression tests
 * Fixed Engine tests where we refer to unexisting
   variable in context
   (now YAQL raises an error when it doesn't find a
    value using given key)
 * Fixed tests on join (new way to check test correction)

 * YAQL 1.0 has its own builtin functions len() and str
   therefore our ones were deleted.
 * YAQL 1.0 uses '$.where' function instead of '$[$...]'

Implements: blueprint yaql-v1-0

Change-Id: I1b46c4e12aee6f25d1e9ca9daa1da059baf6fb68

commit_message:
Multipath commands with error messages in stdout fail to parse

This change fixes an issue in find_multipath_device() where the command
output of ‚Äòmultipath -l <device>‚Äô would sometimes fail to be parsed if
there were error messages in the stdout string in addition to the
expected output. We will now strip out the error messages before we
attempt to parse the lines.

Change-Id: I3d48debc7d64f6a891ac37d4c2c5ebddfb5b00b0
Closes-Bug: #1380742

revisions:

The fixes introduced in order to resolve
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1409142 (CVE-2015-0259) make
novncproxy_base_url relevant on hosts running the nova-novncproxy
service, whereas previously it was only used by nova-compute to
construct VNC console urls.

This change moves the setting of the novncproxy_base_url option out of
compute.pp and into nova::vncproxy_common, where it can be used both
by compute.pp and vncproxy.pp.

Change-Id: I7af4cf8257f2bdbc7d3cc57930fd6371571db531
'}]
commit_message:
move setting of novncproxy_base_url

The fixes introduced in order to resolve
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1409142 (CVE-2015-0259) make
novncproxy_base_url relevant on hosts running the nova-novncproxy
service, whereas previously it was only used by nova-compute to
construct VNC console urls.

This change moves the setting of the novncproxy_base_url option out of
compute.pp and into nova::vncproxy_common, where it can be used both
by compute.pp and vncproxy.pp.

Change-Id: I7af4cf8257f2bdbc7d3cc57930fd6371571db531

commit_message:
Create initiator id if not exist in VMAX driver

This problem was discovered in a customer's environment. If the
initiator id (hardware id SMI-S instance) does not exist on the
array, the attach volume operation will fail. In this patch,
the initiator id will be created if it doesn't exist.

Change-Id: I868118528d831a9f49081a6393e64eb7a414b36f
Closes-Bug: #1440427

subject: Correct wsgi_daemon_process_options key
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-07 21:18:17.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp', 'spec/defines/openstacklib_wsgi_apache_spec.rb'], 'message': "Correct wsgi_daemon_process_options key

'owner' is not a valid option for the WSGIDaemonProcess directive. The
correct option is 'user' [1]. Trying to set 'owner' causes the service
to be unable to start. This patch corrects that option name.

[1] https://code.google.com/p/modwsgi/wiki/ConfigurationDirectives#WSGIDaemonProcess

Change-Id: I907fbcb48db823ea8f5caca4496efaaa456ef69c
"}]
commit_message:
Correct wsgi_daemon_process_options key

'owner' is not a valid option for the WSGIDaemonProcess directive. The
correct option is 'user' [1]. Trying to set 'owner' causes the service
to be unable to start. This patch corrects that option name.

[1] https://code.google.com/p/modwsgi/wiki/ConfigurationDirectives#WSGIDaemonProcess

Change-Id: I907fbcb48db823ea8f5caca4496efaaa456ef69c

commit_message:
Fix keystone unit tests

Commit d4073c2 in openstacklib changed the parameters that the keystone
module uses to authenticate. We forgot to update the mocks in the
keystone tests with this change. This patch corrects that mistake.

Change-Id: I9422925984cbc386695fedce950bdb795d7f478d
