subject: Fixed django-nose requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-02 07:34:27.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Fixed django-nose requirement

murano-dashboard tests are just completely failing when
using django-nose 1.1, with the below error:

OptionConflictError: option -p/--pattern:
    conflicting option string(s): -p

This patch imposes Django>=1.2 to reflect the current reality.

Change-Id: Ic98f52be11cad629b9f2b567a65c1c36d27abbbb
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed django-nose requirement

murano-dashboard tests are just completely failing when
using django-nose 1.1, with the below error:

OptionConflictError: option -p/--pattern:
    conflicting option string(s): -p

This patch imposes Django>=1.2 to reflect the current reality.

Change-Id: Ic98f52be11cad629b9f2b567a65c1c36d27abbbb

subject: Fixed regression in the RPC module
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-10 06:53:34.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/rpc.py'], 'message': 'Fixed regression in the RPC module

Code related to RPC that was moved from the API application to the
global RPC module used an invalid type for the version (float instead of
string).

Change-Id: I0f06cc6324065926b8db05d0015a4a689700c557
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed regression in the RPC module

Code related to RPC that was moved from the API application to the
global RPC module used an invalid type for the version (float instead of
string).

commit_message:
Make cells Response de/serialize objects

Currently, cells messaging Response lacks the ability to serialize and
deserialize objects. This change adds support so that message methods
in cells/messaging.py are enabled to respond with objects.

Closes-Bug: #1438514

Change-Id: Ie87167bc1cce25e25ffad2214dfe3c78ef830561

subject: Set line-height for search-icons
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-09 16:22:02.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/templates/catalog/index.html', 'muranodashboard/static/muranodashboard/css/catalog.css', 'muranodashboard/templates/services/_data_table.html'], 'message': "Set line-height for search-icons

Before, to set correct height of search icons 'top' property of
form-control-feedback class was overriden from default horizon value of
0. This caused other icons in dynamic-ui be incorrectly positioned.

This commit sets line-height for search icons to center the
search icons and not alter any other value.

Change-Id: Ie65a9d4e896be6558fb1137565c2d0afeb720d24
Closes-Bug: #1439024

commit_message:
Set line-height for search-icons

Before, to set correct height of search icons 'top' property of
form-control-feedback class was overriden from default horizon value of
0. This caused other icons in dynamic-ui be incorrectly positioned.

This commit sets line-height for search icons to center the
search icons and not alter any other value.

Change-Id: Ie65a9d4e896be6558fb1137565c2d0afeb720d24
Closes-Bug: #1439024

commit_message:
Stacktrace on live migration monitoring

If we catch a error during the live migration monitoring we should
stacktrace since this is an unexpected error.

Just add exc_info in order to not change the translated string since we
are in a string freeze.

Change-Id: I75dacb49b1f2881b6030e0e1ac3e577debc4942c
Related-Bug: #1438803

I applied for a proper group name for Magnum with fedora.  See
infrastructure ticket:

This allows serving files from:

    https://fedorapeople.org/groups/magnum/

commit_message:
Use new location for atomic images

I applied for a proper group name for Magnum with fedora.  See
infrastructure ticket:

    https://fedorahosted.org/fedora-infrastructure/ticket/4717

This allows serving files from:

    https://fedorapeople.org/groups/magnum/

Closes-Bug: #1442450

Change devtack and documentation accordingly.

Change-Id: I37b005bc50b8045d47c99085ddf8b6b7196a3fa2

subject: Get members from DB when deleting loadbalancer
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-02 11:55:54.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_neutron_autoscaling.py', 'heat/engine/resources/neutron/loadbalancer.py'], 'message': 'Get members from DB when deleting loadbalancer

When the Load Balancer members are created as a result of autoscaling
groups update or adjust, the reference to the current members is
stored in the database and not in the template. so heat will miss some
members when delete loadbalancer.

Change-Id: Ibcd763b3d73f91b3c09bcf3b5e3162fcf100c3d0
Closes-Bug: #1310602
'}]
commit_message:
Get members from DB when deleting loadbalancer

When the Load Balancer members are created as a result of autoscaling
groups update or adjust, the reference to the current members is
stored in the database and not in the template. so heat will miss some
members when delete loadbalancer.

Change-Id: Ibcd763b3d73f91b3c09bcf3b5e3162fcf100c3d0
Closes-Bug: #1310602

commit_message:
Add --preview option to stack abandon command

Option --preview is used to get abandon data without deleting the
stack. It's very useful to perform dry run abandon before stack update
to get a copy of healthy data for later adopt if update failure found.

Partical-Bug: #1300830
Change-Id: Ie3f0d15c1841e22825bb203e455e93d9f9ca2495

commit_message:
Implements neutron group based policy resources

This is the first in a series of patches which implement
resources for neutron group policy APIs.

This patch implements four new resources:
 - Endpoint
 - EndpointGroup
 - L2-Policy
 - L3-Policy

Implements: blueprint neutron-grouppolicy

Change-Id: Ifa7372c3a1fefadafb74718ea3ff1c48c0d48c4b

commit_message:
Group policy API-2 resources: Classifiers, Actions and Rules

This is the second patch in the Group Policy resources implementation
series. This patch implements:
Policy Classifiers
Policy Actions
Policy Rules

In the context of larger Group Policy model, the Policy Rule resource
is referenced by Contracts, which will be introduced in the subsequent
patch.

Change-Id: Iaff15a534f7ac6b979c8b783907705406ee2cbb2
Implements: blueprint neutron-grouppolicy

revisions:

This is the third patch in the Group Policy resources implementation
series. This patch implements:
Contracts

In the context of larger Group Policy model, Contracts contain Policy
Rules and Endpoint Groups consume or provide Contracts.

Change-Id: If12f966ac360d2dd9f459d720fc4114e7ffc6e9e
Implements: blueprint neutron-grouppolicy
'}]
commit_message:
Group Policy API-3: Contracts

This is the third patch in the Group Policy resources implementation
series. This patch implements:
Contracts

In the context of larger Group Policy model, Contracts contain Policy
Rules and Endpoint Groups consume or provide Contracts.

Change-Id: If12f966ac360d2dd9f459d720fc4114e7ffc6e9e
Implements: blueprint neutron-grouppolicy

subject: validate a invalid number_typed parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-29 08:14:08.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_validate.py', 'heat/engine/parameters.py'], 'message': "validate a invalid number_typed parameter

if input a invalid string (i.e.'aaaa') to a number type parameter
heat will raise a ERROR but create the stack sucessfully.
Because other operations like stack-list will parse existing stack again,
these operations will fail and lead strange behavior to heat user.

Change-Id: Ifbf266a595a0cbe1f8f4990757ca83a456f2b997
Closes-bug: #1321549
"}]
commit_message:
validate a invalid number_typed parameter

if input a invalid string (i.e.'aaaa') to a number type parameter
heat will raise a ERROR but create the stack sucessfully.
Because other operations like stack-list will parse existing stack again,
these operations will fail and lead strange behavior to heat user.

Change-Id: Ifbf266a595a0cbe1f8f4990757ca83a456f2b997
Closes-bug: #1321549

subject: Require at least 8 chars for auth_encryption_key
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-23 20:26:12.000000000', 'files': ['etc/heat/heat.conf.sample', 'heat/common/crypt.py', 'heat/tests/test_common_crypt.py'], 'message': 'Require at least 8 chars for auth_encryption_key

If a custom auth_encryption_key is set, and the custom
key is less than 32 chars, the encryption/decryption
fails with a trace. We can however easily pad it
to 32 chars. Add tests.

Change-Id: I6c461416d9889165af0eb003e5903bc188156464
'}]
commit_message:
Require at least 8 chars for auth_encryption_key

If a custom auth_encryption_key is set, and the custom
key is less than 32 chars, the encryption/decryption
fails with a trace. We can however easily pad it
to 32 chars. Add tests.

Change-Id: I6c461416d9889165af0eb003e5903bc188156464

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-01 10:49:24.000000000', 'files': ['specs/assertstatesoftheinstances.rst'], 'message': 'Title:Heat to assert the states of the server

Heat today does not assert the state of the Server that is provisioned from the Heat template. I propose Heat to assert the states of the server in order to be able to update or add to the configuration of the heat template at any given point of time and from/to any state of the Server

Change-Id: I7fbe6d773e8ea01fb819692f0ff587783cd7192d
'}]
commit_message:
Title:Heat to assert the states of the server

Heat today does not assert the state of the Server that is provisioned from the Heat template. I propose Heat to assert the states of the server in order to be able to update or add to the configuration of the heat template at any given point of time and from/to any state of the Server

Change-Id: I7fbe6d773e8ea01fb819692f0ff587783cd7192d

Add a ref target to each README

This allows for much easier linking to each element's README, as
demonstrated in the change to caches.rst

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-13 13:08:28.000000000', 'files': ['specs/hot-section-encryption.rst'], 'message': 'Encryption/decryption of sections in a HOT template.

For security, licensing and other reasons it is desirable
to have encryption capability enabling free exchange of HOT
sections while still ensuring that only the intended parties
can use them.

Change-Id: Ib5b7ebc56f1c69bcd282cc5831599bd818972b8b
'}]
commit_message:
Encryption/decryption of sections in a HOT template.

For security, licensing and other reasons it is desirable
to have encryption capability enabling free exchange of HOT
sections while still ensuring that only the intended parties
can use them.

Change-Id: Ib5b7ebc56f1c69bcd282cc5831599bd818972b8b

subject: Automatically pull all element READMEs into docs
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-12 18:05:37.000000000', 'files': ['bin/prepare-readmes', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/ext/__init__.py', 'doc/source/elements', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'doc/ext/prepare_readmes.py'], 'message': "Automatically pull all element READMEs into docs

This adds a tiny sphinx extension that runs a shell script that copies
(with modifications) each element's README.rst into the doc tree.

The elements symlink is deleted; this is no longer required, as the
directory is recreated each time the docs job is run.

Change-Id: I1d2c6b5021cdeb00eb6e3a13c8a56d5b7ee94154
"}]
commit_message:
Automatically pull all element READMEs into docs

This adds a tiny sphinx extension that runs a shell script that copies
(with modifications) each element's README.rst into the doc tree.

The elements symlink is deleted; this is no longer required, as the
directory is recreated each time the docs job is run.

Change-Id: I1d2c6b5021cdeb00eb6e3a13c8a56d5b7ee94154

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2014-08-08 01:54:58.000000000', 'files': ['toci_devtest.sh'], 'message': 'Add a vlan check

Adds a vlan check job for TripleO

This is intended to be used for testing new public-IP functionality.

This patchset partially completes a spec which will one day live at
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo/+specs/tripleo-juno-virtual-public-ips
but for now can bee seen in  Id9addc65f0d2ed519ce4b3edbd561ed660a2786e.

The details of the public VIP - including vlan tags, interface names,
network ranges and so on - are assumed to be provided in $TE_DATAFILE
but not activated by default.

Change-Id: I0f9e4cd4dfca3e7baae747255bc84e6efd52bcd2
Requires: I231c0aaff787c8dd88f50587b6a5cdf9c9e63b0f
Requires: I78c0fa3902c1e480b7ada0055332b14828c3c7f9
'}]
commit_message:
Add a vlan check

Adds a vlan check job for TripleO

This is intended to be used for testing new public-IP functionality.

This patchset partially completes a spec which will one day live at
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo/+specs/tripleo-juno-virtual-public-ips
but for now can bee seen in  Id9addc65f0d2ed519ce4b3edbd561ed660a2786e.

The details of the public VIP - including vlan tags, interface names,
network ranges and so on - are assumed to be provided in $TE_DATAFILE
but not activated by default.

Change-Id: I0f9e4cd4dfca3e7baae747255bc84e6efd52bcd2
Requires: I231c0aaff787c8dd88f50587b6a5cdf9c9e63b0f
Requires: I78c0fa3902c1e480b7ada0055332b14828c3c7f9

commit_message:
No need to create APIVersionRequest every time

APIVersionRequest will be created everytime when the microversion
is used. Actually we can create them once and used later.

Change-Id: I5d62003b87b85bc5020fe32788d255bc7273a9c9

subject: auth_encryption_key is being checked to be 16, 24, or 32
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-03-31 11:32:33.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/crypt.py', 'heat/tests/test_heatclient.py', 'heat/common/config.py'], 'message': 'auth_encryption_key is being checked to be 16, 24, or 32

If auth_encryption_key length is not 16 or 24 or 32 in that case
heat operations such as stack-creates fails. This check has been
added.

Change-Id: Ic653d18dbb7523ca5286ae0951eb86ad72cbdb13
Closes-bug: #1415887
'}]
commit_message:
auth_encryption_key is being checked to be 16, 24, or 32

If auth_encryption_key length is not 16 or 24 or 32 in that case
heat operations such as stack-creates fails. This check has been
added.

Change-Id: Ic653d18dbb7523ca5286ae0951eb86ad72cbdb13
Closes-bug: #1415887

commit_message:
Add ability to hide stacks based on tag

Add a "hidden_stack_tags" option that contains a list of tag names.
Stacks that have one or more of these tags will be hidden.

Add an option to show hidden stacks in the stack listing.

blueprint stack-tags

Change-Id: I45a5ac6d73a9a61629a56f88270e3a97fafb378a

The current schema of constraints allow to use default values for
required=True. However we never use it except in unittests, because
user should set it always, which looks like not required property.

message.

Change-Id: Ic6ace30742e887069f119a14ffb091f6bac9e682
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate using required=True with default value

The current schema of constraints allow to use default values for
required=True. However we never use it except in unittests, because
user should set it always, which looks like not required property.
This patch adds checking for constraint schema class with warning
message.

Change-Id: Ic6ace30742e887069f119a14ffb091f6bac9e682

commit_message:
Make disk property of flavor default

DISK property of NovaFlavor resource is ambiguous: it is required
and it has default value. The property has been changed to
default only (to support compatibility and not break
existing templates). In addition, added test that check resources
about amibigious property definition.

Change-Id: I51be18b7201e78d6af261f678ddf440aa0fa893e
Closes-bug: #1436331

commit_message:
Fix a issue for kafka-publisher and refactor the test code

Fix a issue which causes error when default policy is selected.
Add test codes to avoid the same mistakes again.
Fix a bug of the test code which is:
* KafkaBrokerPublisher tries to connect localhost when __init__
  is called because of the lack of mocking _get_client function
  before initializing KafkaBrokerPublisher.

Closes-Bug: 1441175
Closes-Bug: 1441258
Change-Id: I306db443a866860ee45b2362b8a0cd2a59d8c3a2

subject: Fix here-document usage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-09 23:17:16.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/devstack/prepare_devstack.sh'], 'message': "Fix here-document usage

Use tabs instead of whitespace to indent lines of the here-document. Tabs
indent the text properly in the shell script and are omitted from the output.
Otherwise, running the shell script produces this error:

./prepare_devstack.sh: line 30: warning: here-document at line 21 delimited by
end-of-file (wanted `EOF')
./prepare_devstack.sh: line 31: syntax error: unexpected end of file

Change-Id: I893cd43dfbebd751b0ad5fb3ffff188c40fc862e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix here-document usage

Use tabs instead of whitespace to indent lines of the here-document. Tabs
indent the text properly in the shell script and are omitted from the output.
Otherwise, running the shell script produces this error:

./prepare_devstack.sh: line 30: warning: here-document at line 21 delimited by
end-of-file (wanted `EOF')
./prepare_devstack.sh: line 31: syntax error: unexpected end of file

Change-Id: I893cd43dfbebd751b0ad5fb3ffff188c40fc862e

policies/

commit_message:
Create policy via Horizon

* congress.py: New API function to create a policy.

policies/
* forms.py: Form to create a policy.
* tables.py: Move code for listing a policy's rules in a table to a new module,
  keeping the rules code separate. Add new button to create a policy.

policies/rules/
* __init__.py: Separate out rules code into its own module.
* tables.py: Moved rules code from policies/table.py to here.
* urls.py: Add new url for policy creation.
* views.py: Add new view for policy creation. Get PolicyRulesTable from new
  rules module. Add more logging.

policies/templates/policies/
* _create.html: Form to create a new policy.
* create.html: Contains modal form to create a new policy.
* policies_table.html, policy_rules_table.html: Remove unused templates.

Partially implements blueprint: horizon-create-policies

Change-Id: I93337d0d47a94c13960a7fa69aa97edec8615f9b

commit_message:
publish policy table result to dse bus

This patch implements subscriptions for the policy engine. That is,
every time someone subscribes to a policy engine table, the policy
engine will publish the results of that table on the message bus.

Implements blueprint: publish-policy-results-to-bus

Change-Id: I8161d233e64a9bff5d4fa31c02b368a5ef75c878

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-04-09 18:15:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'Honor uuid parameter passed to nova-network create

The nova api for creating nova-network networks has an optional
request parameter "id" which maps to the string uuid for the
network to create. The nova-manage network create command represents
it as the option --uuid. The parameter is currently being ignored
by the nova-network manager. This change sets the uuid when creating
the network if it has been specified.

Closes-Bug: #1441931

Change-Id: Ib29e632b09905f557a7a6910d58207ed91cdc047
'}]
commit_message:
Honor uuid parameter passed to nova-network create

The nova api for creating nova-network networks has an optional
request parameter "id" which maps to the string uuid for the
network to create. The nova-manage network create command represents
it as the option --uuid. The parameter is currently being ignored
by the nova-network manager. This change sets the uuid when creating
the network if it has been specified.

Closes-Bug: #1441931

Change-Id: Ib29e632b09905f557a7a6910d58207ed91cdc047

commit_message:
Refactor nova-net cidr validation in prep for bug fix

The network manager create_networks function is on the verge of the
"too complex" pep8 check error, so this change refactors the cidr
validation code out into a private function in preparation for
fixing a bug.

Change-Id: Id0603ddd642acccfa12ae53a52ecfb66dca53702

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 7217, 'name': 'Hugh Saunders', 'email': 'hugh@wherenow.org', 'username': 'hughsaunders'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 9312, 'name': 'Alexandre Levine', 'email': 'alexandrelevine@gmail.com', 'username': 'alevine'}, {'_account_id': 10224, 'name': 'Feodor Tersin', 'email': 'ftersin@hotmail.com', 'username': 'ftersin'}, {'_account_id': 10234, 'name': 'Andrey Pavlov', 'email': 'andrey.mp@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrey-mp'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-07 07:29:31.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/thirdparty/boto/test_ec2_network.py'], 'message': "Remove EC2 test case that incompatible with Amazon

This test tries to allocate address and disassociate it without association.
Amazon allows to do it for EC2-classic and does not throw error.
But EC2 implementation in Nova throws error.
We have the same test in our own test suite against stackforge/ec2-api
(but it's not merged yet) and I checked it against Amazon -
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/171050/

I suggest to remove this test from tempest as incompatible with Amazon.
Also because of EC2 is deprecated in nova and can't be fixed.

Change-Id: I711314408ec7c4ea75f93348a7335843713e9a2b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove EC2 test case that incompatible with Amazon

This test tries to allocate address and disassociate it without association.
Amazon allows to do it for EC2-classic and does not throw error.
But EC2 implementation in Nova throws error.
We have the same test in our own test suite against stackforge/ec2-api
(but it's not merged yet) and I checked it against Amazon -
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/171050/

I suggest to remove this test from tempest as incompatible with Amazon.
Also because of EC2 is deprecated in nova and can't be fixed.

Change-Id: I711314408ec7c4ea75f93348a7335843713e9a2b

commit_message:
accept languagepack name or uuid when prompting during 'app create'

During 'app create', we list and prompt for a languagepack if one
is not given using the --lp flag or in the planfile.

At this point, we only accept LP names, we should accept uuids as
well, just like in the planfile.

Change-Id: I9ebeb056475bcb46158d83e3dfd9ab1c339c5d38
Closes-bug: 1441886

commit_message:
Libvirt: preallocate_images CONFIG can be arbitrary characters

We can now set preallocate_images as any characters as long as it is
not equal to 'none' to enable preallocate images function, this is
too bad.

This patch changes the condition to equal to 'space'/'Space'/'SPACE'

Closes-Bug: 1427092
Change-Id: Ie8f4861fb77d2c3c3a8976fb7768ced12e7d8d5b
